Reviews.Title: “First trip to Europe!”
Reviews.Author: Jojo1958248
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Hotel was exactly everything that tripadvisor said on their website. The hotel offers a very nice and big room, very clean and the people at the front desk are very helpfull. This hotel also offers breakfast with your stay and it's really worth it. The hotel is at a stone throw away from their metro system and a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly boutique hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SidingsPhotography
Reviews.Content: We have just came back from a lovely weekend break at Le Walt in Paris and found this hotel to be absolutely amazing! Le Walt is situated just next to Ecole Militaire metro station (line 8) and also almost on the edge of Parc Du Champ De Mars which means that the Eiffel Tower is just minutes away. There are restaurants around and even a convenience store on the oposite site of the street. Our room (we requested one on the top floor) was tiny but very cosy and we had amazing views as the windows were facing the Eiffel Tower! We could also spot Sacre Coeur after leaning out of the window. Both room and the bathroom were clean and very nicely decorated. The room was equipped not only with TV but also a DVD player. There is also a free WiFi connection available. And last but not least - the staff. They were all so kind and welcoming which is not so common nowadays! It was a pleasure to stay at Le Walt, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, nice hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: KA_and_MA
Reviews.Content: Le Walt is a nice boutique hotel with a GREAT location, HOWEVER it’s good to be aware of a few facts, not to be disappointed about the choice: 1. This is NOT a design hotel which you count on taking a look at the pictures. I was a bit expecting, the classical paintings will be mixed with a modern, design furniture, bathroom etc, but it’s definitely not. All the furniture, lamps, bathroom are simple and rather basic, however the room as a whole, although really tiny- makes quite a nice impression 2. I’m not sure it makes sense to pay extra for an executive room- I can’t imagine superior could be any smaller… I saw the difference on the web site – a small sitting area on top of superior room, but there was nothing like this in reality in the room we got. It was a room no. 402- I even had a doubt we got a right room, but receptionist confirmed it’s the executive one. As for the size of a room, the bathroom is quite spacious. 3. The rooms which have an Eiffel view are quite noisy as facing quite a busy street. Personally I enjoyed it, but if you want some quiet and a night with an open window- rather ask for a courtyard side. 4. This is a perfect hotel if you’re coming for the weekend, want to see a lot and enjoy the city. The rooms are too tiny for a longer stay in my personal opinion BESIDES Hotel staff is nice and friendly Wifi works well and it’s free Hotel is right next to Ecole Militiare Metro, so you got an easy access whenever you need It’s a walking distance to Eiffel tower and Invalides, lots of bars and restaurants around, also a small Carrefour and eco shop just a few steps away A few tips that could be helpful: • Do not order a breakfast when booking a room- you can always buy it, BUT there are so many places just a few steps away to enjoy (example: Le Terrasse just a few steps away on the corner, serves breakfasts from 7:30- 11:30) • Check the rates on hotel’s own web site. It was more attractive then booking.com when I was making my reservation as I was able to order a “last minute offer”. Also- if you just had a birthday, they have something special for you  • If you like to enjoy a piece of “local life” go to the Rue Cler (turn right when getting out from the hotel, cross the street and turn first left)- you can see street sellers of fruits, flowers, meet, fish and have a breakfast or just a coffee there. • 7 le Vin 68 avenue Bosquet it’s a nice, small restaurant nearby with a great friendly, English speaking stuff and delicious food. It’s better to make a reservation as the place is quite busy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SeeingTheWorldNow_11
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Hotel Le Walt and had a wonderful stay. Mr. Robinson & the staff were friendly, helpful and very accommodating. The location is great, the rooms are great and the bathrooms are very large for Paris standards. Hotel Le Walt is my little Parisian Secret....but perhaps not anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, made our trip special!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne13ncl
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! It is in a brilliant location, you can see the Eiffel Tower from some rooms- we could see the top from our fourth floor room but that is not the reason the location is so good. It is a ten minute romantic stroll to the Tower, it is right next to the Ecole Militiare Metro and next to some great restaurants and bars. The staff were great- they are so friendly and happy to help with anything we needed. The rooms were not the largest- but that is paris. They were clean and luxurious. We would recommend eating at the Le Terrasse which is opposite on the corner- amazing french onion soup! Cocktails in La Tourville on the opposite corner. Pastries from down the road. Saint Dominique Bistro is about a ten minute walk and amazing for a romantic dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy L
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Le Walt and found the hotel to be excellent for our group's needs. The rooms were large and extremely comfortable. Wifi worked very well. The staff was excellent and very quick to help us with our every need. I can highly recommend Le Walt.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: Jayaw
Reviews.Content: We visited Le Walt in 2009 and liked it, so we returned last weekend with friends for a special occasion. It is ideally situated, right next to Ecole Militaire metro. Within a couple of minutes walk you can be at the end of the Champs de Mar and enjoy a 10 minute stroll through the gardens to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is clean and comfortable but what really stands out are the staff. They are all really charming and helpful. They speak many different languages, and kindly tolerated my rusty French! Our room was on the ground floor in the courtyard. The courtyard is a little haven and very peaceful. We did find though that we could hear (and feel!) the metro rumbling underneath us. We quite liked it but if you are a light sleeper, avoid the ground floor! We had a misunderstanding with our bill, as we were charged for our friend's room and vice versa, which we didn't realise until returning home. Within a couple of days, this was sorted and we were kindly refunded. We would recommend the restaurant next door, Comptoir du Sept, really lovely food and staff and cool decor. We had a fantastic breakfast at Cafe Central on Rue Cler nearby. We will definitely return to Le Walt, and would recommend it for location, cleanliness and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Walt!”
Reviews.Author: kharlie
Reviews.Content: We were here in summer 2011, and would definitely go back! Loved the style, cleanliness, location, etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: ANDREWAJBOW
Reviews.Content: First visit to Paris, browsed reviews - great choice for us. Small boutique hotel with "nice" style and GREAT staff. Upgraded to executive room which was over the courtyard, we could open windows and it was very quite all night. Rececptionist/Concierge Madeleine was great and very helpful. Close to Eifel tower Metro was right there. Hope to return soon, loved Paris!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business, not romance”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: We were bumped into this hotel the day before we arrived into Paris for our wedding anniversary. Despite our initial reservations the hotel was a delight. The breakfast was very good and the location is very handy to the metro so you can get to the major attractions easily within Paris and also walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel provided free wifi. A great hotel for business but not a romantic escape.

Reviews.Title: “3+ to 4- in Invalides Paris”
Reviews.Author: steaknchips
Reviews.Content: Very well located in Invalides. The Le Walt is withing walking distance of the Eifel tower and the Seine via the Champs de Mar. The location is a elegant boulevard within easy reach of Hotel Invalides and the Rodin Museum with the Ecole Militaire metro station practically on the doorstep. the nearby rue de cler has plenty of reasonable cafes and restaurants for breakfst and dinner. There are other cafes and restaurants even nearer to the hotel. We received a warm welcome on arrival and our room was comfortable. If possible upgrade to a superior room as in keeping with the Paris trend the roooms are small. The bathroom was good and Reasonably spacious. A mirror in the bedroom would be helpful. we had breakfast in the hotel one moring. At €16, it was reasonable for Paris. It was a bit limited but the cheeses and cold meats were very good and there was a nice selection of fruit and very pleasant service. The cooked food looked a bit unappetising. We enjoyed the hotel adn teh location as it was not our first time in Paris. This is not really in the 4 * Boutique hotel but it was in Paris and we had a nice time. If you are afirst time visitor go for teh atmosphere of Mont Martre (althoug touristy) or St Germain

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Safe”
Reviews.Author: MelfromCincy
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Paris last minute for 2 nights, as I was traveling alone for a business trip to Germany. The night before, I booked the first hotel I found on Expedia that was available under $200. I absolutely loved the decor of Hotel Le Walt. It is situated in a safe and friendly area, just a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. Across the street was a market and just a block away was the subway. For the hotel itself, the room is very small, but clean and modern with lovely decor. The breakfast was very nice and the server kept me company as I waited several hours to check in as my room was not available until after 2pm. All & all I would recommend this hotel if you can find the price under $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but would stay elsewhere if possible...”
Reviews.Author: qwerty85
Reviews.Content: This is a well situated hotel. There are great restaurants and boulangerie in the area, the metro stop is just ourside your door, and there is a grocery store (open late) right across the street. I LOVE this area - the Rue Cler market is the biggest reason to stay in this area. However, I would not stay in this hotel again. Although we received good service, and the room was decent, there was a lot of noise (thin walls/noisy neighbours?) that prevented us from getting a good night's sleep. If you are very sensitive to noise, beware: the rumble of the metro is audible. My biggest reason for not wanting to stay in this hotel again was the bathroom. While it was big, and came with slippers, robes and a hair dryer, the shower was pretty gross - which to me, is a deal breaker. I would stay in this area again, but not at this hotel if I could avoid it...

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: koality
Reviews.Content: Le Walt is a wonderful boutique hotel located minutes from the Tour Eiffel, the Cahmps de Mars and les Invalides. In this wonderful neighborhood there are countless restaurants within walking distance and the Metro stop is on the corner. You c an easily walk to the Right Bank within 20 minutes. The staff at the hotel is warm, courteous, professional and friendly. I have stayed here approximately 10 times and will only stay here when I am in Paris. For the critics who say that the rooms are too small, I can only answer that my room is huge for a city and the enormous bathroom has a dressing area and a window. You must look around at the rooms if there is a choice and you should choose one in the back facing the courtyard. As for the critics of the breakfast, don't take it. There are wonderful brasseries and pastry shops around the corner. My rate includes breakfast even though I choose only a coffee, so I do not have this problem. Finally, the wonderful rue Cler, filled with restaurant and food stores, is across the street. For me, in Paris, this is my home. From, koality

Reviews.Title: “Horrible receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl081
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while ravelling throughout Europe. The rooms were very basic and small in size but were clean. The receptionist was the rudest woman who yelled at clients and made my husband and I very uncomfortable. We would try to avoid her and ask questions at night when the young gentleman was back on duty. The location was close to the Eiffel Tower, but dealing with the terrible receptionist was not worth this hotel stay at all! Will never go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good hotel; BAD RECEPTIONIST”
Reviews.Author: RobertoChile
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, cozy, with good amenities, in an excellent situation close to Tour Eiffel and Ecole Militaire. The only porblme is a women receptionist who really is very unporfessional not at all warm, at the contrary very rude with clients. I booked for 2 periods and when I arrived with collegues the scond time, they sent me to another 4 stars hotel of the same company but absolutely not the same, and it is cheaper. I already paid rhe walt. Not for comming again with these kind of receptionist

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way gem”
Reviews.Author: Rbs7562
Reviews.Content: Eclectic decor, spacious rooms by the Ecole Militaire Metro. Great neighborhood, convenient to everything and a great change from your typical tourist hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great staff. Wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: jimaryann
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Paris with my family. The Hotel le Walt was perfect and the location in a basically residential district was wonderful for us. It was close to good restaurants and Rue Cler, within walking distance to many sites - Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb, etc. - and access to transportation to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnphelan30
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife celebrated our 1st wedding anniversary at Le Walt and stayed for 3 night, very expensive price for Saturday night stay, Thursday and Friday price was ok. Great Location for Eiffel Tower and Metro for travel, however noise levels from other rooms was very poor, just as well we took ear plugs, due to the constant noise of pipes being banged or chairs being moved constantly. Staff not very friendly, I was charged for breakfast for 3 nights for 2 people, even though I did not book or eat breakfast, at 16 euros each, this was very unprofessional, when I pointed out the error, I didn't even receive an apology. We booked the river cruise for Saturday evening, discussed with hotel and information was poor, so booked directly with company, felt pressured to book with hotel even though we did not receive information on menu, etc. Liked the area of Paris for hotel, lovely bakery and supermarket with cafes locally but would not stay in this hotel again, don't think the staff expect guests to return anyhow.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: karen47906
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the Hotel Le Walt are above average in size by Paris standards and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful - down the street from Rue Cler, an open-air market, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, next to a metro station and nearby to many good restaurants and bakeries.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Journey_on_earth
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel, browsing on Trip Advisor. Booked directly on their web page. At arrival, checkin was quick and easy. I took the executive room (28m2) to have more floor space. Good move because it's not that big but still good for Paris. Maybe we are spoiled in North america, our standard hotel rooms being in the range of 40+m2. I can't imaging what the smaller rooms look like... One helpful detail: the room type (executive, superior, etc.) is written on the room card located on the back of the door. This avoids arguments on the room type. The wall portrait is spectacular but it's the only decoration. The other walls are white and the furniture is plain. Flat screen tv, dvd player and minibar are provided. I liked the wooden floor but the downside is that you hear every move of your neighbour above. They should, at least, put felt pads under the chair legs. The bathroom is clean and well equipped. The bed was good and firm. I gave a - on the sleep quality because of noisy people opening and closing doors every 5 minutes (really!), from 12h30AM until 2h00 on one night. The buffet breakfast is good and filled with fresh food. It's open from 7AM. There's a selection of small croissants, chocolatines, pastries, sweet cereals, fruit salad, eggs, sausages, bacon, cheeses, cold cuts and orange juice. Fresh coffee is brewed upon your arrival. The attendants are courteous and helpfull. The hotel is located near many restaurants (on the same street and on Cler street). There's a grocery store right in front and a metro station (ecole militaire) at the door step. The neighborhood is rather quiet and safe. Checkout was also quick and prices as quoted. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: suzanne154989
Reviews.Content: we so enjoyed our stay of 5 nights on la motte picquet. on check in we asked for a room with a view and were given room 602. small but superbe overlooking the eiffel tower. buffet breakfast delicious and got us off to a great start. couldn't have had a better home in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Herkbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Walt for three nights knowing that it would be close to the sites that we wanted to see. What we didn't realize was how much we would enjoy our stay there. The hotel has a very comfortable feel. It's smaller and everyone was very friendly and helpful. There is an outdoor courtyard and a pleasant breakfast area. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Our room was located on the top floor - room 603. The beds were very comfortable and the mansard roof made for some interesting nooks in the room. The bathroom was large and clean. We were very happy with our room and the price we paid. The hotel is a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Ecole Militaire metro station is just a few steps away. The location has a residential feeling and restaurants and shops are nearby. We will definitely return to the Le Walt upon our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and chic!”
Reviews.Author: Danski2010
Reviews.Content: Big clean bathroom with robes and slippers... windows that opened to let in fresh air... cormfortable bed with white duvet... great location near the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler (open-air market)... friendly staff... free use of laptop in the lobby... delightful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sh29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Walt from 24-27 March, The hotel is a lovely boutique hotel, staff are all very friendly and will do anything to help, it is very well kept, clean and in a perfect location. We had a 5th floor room with a view of the Eiffel tower, perfect!. Opposite the hotel is a great supermarket for necessities that you need. also the metro is right on the corner and is cheap and easy to get around, we used to go to Notre Damn. I would also highly recommend 2 local restaurants. 7 le Vin, which is a 5 minute walk. AMAZING, we went after seeing some reviews on here about it, we had the hotel reserve a table as we wanted to go on a saturday evening. I would recommend you do book as while we where there people where being told there was a hour and half wait for a table. it is only a small restaurant, but the service is imepccable, food was amazing and the wine very very good. we had oysters to start along with mains and a dessert, with a very good bottle of wine and the bill was about £114 which i thought was great value for money for 2 people. The second place to try is La Terrasse, which is located on the corner opposte the hotel, food here was amazing as well, not as classy as 7 Le Vin but ideal for a really nice meal, staff where friendly and happy, didnt need to reserve here. but do give them both a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dom-Michelle
Reviews.Content: Perfect loaction, 10 minutes walk to the Champ De Mars and the Eiffel Tower, and the Metro (Sub) is just a few feets away! Small room though, but very nice and clean with a huge painting (that makes the room looks even smaller but it is nice!). The street is a little bit noisy, a small supermarket called Carrefour Market just accross. Price is high, we were lucky to get a good deal through Expedia and the blind hotels deals (you do not know which hotel it is until the booking is done, were lucky the deal was sweet as the original price for the room we stayed in was tagged behind the door at 330 Euros per night). Breakfast was 16 Euros per person. Too expensive, we went to the bakery buy croissants and pains au chocolat instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aliwoodh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Le Walt and found it ideal for a short break. It is right by Ecole Militaire Metro station and 10 minutes walk maximum from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. The staff were efficient - our room was ready on arrival before noon and the breakfast buffet is pricy at 16 euros but everything is pricy in Paris!. However the food was good, eggs, bacon, cereals, juice, bread, croissants and good coffee. .Our room was on the 6th floor - no view but was perfectly fine, nicely furnished and with a large bathroom. We would willingly stay here again. Free WiFi too

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: tg0610
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Walt is steps from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides, offers spotless, comfortable and well-decorated rooms and, surprisingly, doesn't cost a small fortune. While one should never spend too much time in a hotel room when Paris is just waiting to be seen, the retreats at the end of the day were made all the better by the attentive service, friendly staff and lovely amenities. Truly deserving of its boutique hotel description, we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Le Walt was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah_in_Texas
Reviews.Content: The double room was spacious by Paris boutique hotel standards. The location was absolutely perfect We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GlobalHorizonChaser
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel option. Great location to main tourist attractions, metro right outside and some fantastic Parisian cafes on the doorstep. You really can't go wrong with this hotel if you are a tourist. Highly recommended for all age groups.

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and metro station right across the street.”
Reviews.Author: kharding77
Reviews.Content: Great Location!!!!! Cute & friendly hotel with a lot of personality.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: 2Chollies
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 25th anniversary in Paris and had an amazing time. We were very pleased with our stay at Hotel le Walt. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating, the location was fabulous, convenient and quiet. The room was just fine space-wise, as most reviewers observe...spaciousness is difficult to find in Paris! We were in walking distance of so many amazing places to dine. We walked everywhere, even though we were so close to a metro. The room was quiet. One note: be aware that a regular business guest is permitted to smoke in their room. Given that this is a non-smoking hotel, I'm guessing this guest is always given the same room on the 4th floor. After the second night of smoke-filled room, we asked for a new room and were granted the transfer. A bit inconvenient, but we lucked out.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: mark1001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago and must say it really is a wonderful place to stay. Excellent room, great location, friendly staff. If you have the chance to stay here – please just book – you have found the place you are looking for!! Some details – The room – beautiful, good size. Large bed. Exactly like the pictures on their website - http://en.lewaltparis.com. Big bathroom, lovely towels, heated mirrors etc...(nice!!) Location – just over the road from the park that approaches the Eiffel Tower. Also just over the road from Rue Cler – a wonderful pedestrian road with some excellent restaurants. Hotel is also right next to metro stop – Ecole Militaire – although to be fair we walked everywhere. You can walk to the Louvre in I would say a 45 min pleasant stroll through some beautiful little roads. Service – we were arriving at about 12pm. We had come over on the morning Eurostar from London. I emailed the hotel and asked if we could leave our bags before checking in. They said this would be no problem but when we got there they went one better and checked us in straight away. Perfect start to the holiday. Went to the room, quick wash, change and out!! What I would say is that none of this great service was unexpected – I had heavily researched many hotels and this came up trumps time after time. It did not disappoint. It is the perfect romantic place for a weekend (or longer – we could have stayed there a lot longer!!!). If you were looking for the perfect romantic getaway then this is it!! The perfect evening is all within a stroll of the hotel – dinner on Rue Cler (just walk half down the road, two excellent places by the only junction on the left) – food, wine and then a 5 min stroll to the Eiffel Tower, watch the light show (on the hour), hold hands – have a kiss!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: feist89
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days holiday in Paris. The hotel has an excellent location and it is right next to the Metro station Ecole Militare. We stayed on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower which was fantastic. The room was small but I knew this before I had booked it so I have no complaints about the size. However, the floor boards in the room were coming up next to the door, there paint was flaking away on some parts of the wall and the overall cleanliness ie behind the bed etc was not great. The bed itself was very comfy, the bathroom was fine and the air conditioning worked well. Some guests have complained about noise but we heard nothing, maybe as we were so high up. The only problem we had was a member of staff within the hotel. She was rude and very unhelpful, she seemed to know nothing about Paris, ie a good place to eat. Besides her the rest of the staff were lovely and even though were willing to help they still seemed to know little about where was good to eat. They should maybe have a proper concierge working for them. Overall the hotel was great, although the size of room was small most rooms in Paris are also small and we spent minimal time in the room anyway. Its great for a romanctic getaway and I would recommend reserving a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. I would not recommend coming here for more than 2 or 3 nights though ie a holiday, you can find much larger rooms for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: melodie2450
Reviews.Content: My friend and I found this hotel online but when we arrived there everything was not the same. We think the pics on line were mis leading .we booked a room for 2 people and we got a single bed which in USA we call it full bed. We asked to change but they were booked.After searching 4 hours in Paris to find another Hotel to go to we came back empty handed (Sep. is the month of events in Paris).Although the room was small , it was clean but we were on 6th floor and the every night we could hear disturbing loud noises coming from ceiling!(like some one is repairing the pipes). The shower changed temprature constantly !! This room was not worth 360.00$ per night. I think it was more like a Motel than Hotel .

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: nifric
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has is the LOCATION. We paid for a DELUXE room, this was not DELUXE it looked like my kids room, nothing deluxe abt it. The water in the sink and tub backed up, extremly small, most importantly the day staff were no help what so ever, they were always to busy to answer questions and if you asked you were given a look like " don't bother me" the cleaning people were awful, put pillo case on top of the dirty pillow case, room always dusty, left glass not cleaned still in same area everytime we arrive mold in bathroom, had to ask for soap and toilet paper each time. PLEASE CHOOSE another hotel people!!!!! don't say that we didn't tell you! I will never, ever stay here again. Nid

Reviews.Title: “Where we always stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: NinthCircle
Reviews.Content: Great view of the you-know-what; metro station within crawling distance; grocery store across the street; friendly, helpful staff; convenient to all sorts of wonderful eateries at every price point; pleasant breakfast area and bar. Just do it...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Amazing Views of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: rlgm007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Le Walt in August 2010 in room 601 with an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. People that complain about tiny rooms in Paris either never have visited Paris before or have stayed at the American hotels because unless you stay at the Crillon, Ritz, George V or Grand Hotels in Paris, hotel rooms are always small in Paris. I have visited Paris more than thirty times (I lived in Paris in 1991) and have stayed at a different hotel each time. Last time I went to Paris I stayed on the Isle St. Louis at the Lutece which is a nice hotel with tiny rooms but is twice as expensive as the Le Walt. In July 2010, my sister stayed at the Hotel Le Serre, a 2 star dump, which charges 100 euros a night; whereas, I reserved the 4-star excellent Le Walt at $130 U.S. through Expedia. I almost stayed at the Le Serre but after hearing her complaints I booked the Le Walt. I am so glad because I had a good sized elegant room (see photos). The hotel has a beautiful decor, incredible breakfast 19 euros, great location next to the Ecole Militare Metro and next to the Eiffel Tower, great neighborhood, and great friendly staff. I HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL - I'D GO BACK IN A HEART BEAT. Eat at the Le Terrazze Bistro across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: Diana8207
Reviews.Content: The room, the bathroom everything was very small. The staff were nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kakalina10
Reviews.Content: The hotel Le Walt in paris was just awful. The rooms are tiny,( I have had cruise ship cabins bigger than this) lousy area for paris and the concierge was condescending. We had also booked smoking rooms and were told that the hotel was a non smoking hotel and they wouldn't budge. They did not try to accommodate us in the least. We had booked through hotels.com and I thouroghly researched this hotel about their smoking policy and nowhere did it mention that it was non smoking. The concierge was very argumentitive and started making things up. Just an awful experience and I am glad it was only for 1 night, otherwise I would have changed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small room”
Reviews.Author: canoar
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located steps away from a subway station and a walking distance from the Eiffel Tour and also surrounded by good "cafés". There is a very expensive public parking area 200 meters away, on the other hand they provide free internet access. The staff kinkly helped us whenever we needed information or reservations. The minus goes to the small and noisy room. Try to stay in a room with a view to the Tour. It will take your breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: JackBa1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times but the location of the Le Walt is the best we have found--truly ideal. The 7th is basically a high end residential arrondisement but this particular corner of the 7th. combines a residential feel--grocery stores, wine shops, patisseries (one of which is the fabled Le Notre)--with a lively cafe scene, proximity to major attractions and, very nearby, the food lovers' Rue Cler. Add to this the beautiful trees and buildings of Avenue de la Motte Picquet and adjacent boulevards, the parks of the Champ de Mars (Eiffel Tower) and Invalides short blocks away, the shopping on La Tour Marburg, the short walk to Rodin Museum and Musee D'Orsay, an abundance of great bistros nearby and a Metro stop at your doorstep and you know that there is no better place to stay. The Le Walt itself is stylish with exceedingly accommodating and helpful staff, a charming and inviting patio and free internet in the lobby. It is a very small hotel--22 rooms. The rooms themselves are small but not tiny. Storage is barely adequate; bathrooms nice and with all amenities--ours was very attractive and had w.c. in separate room. Anything needed was produced with alacrity but several quickly responded to calls failed to result in our air conditioning being more than minimally adequate (though our friends did not have a similar problem). Bed was exceptionally comfortable and as our room faced courtyard it was quiet. My major complaint was that the lighting in the room is far less than adequate--reading was really only possible in the bathroom. The hotel is, again, stylish and charming with an extremely accommodating, pleasant and helpful staff. It has its drawbacks but the fantastic location overrides all. Unless someone builds a better hotel on the same block the Le Walt will be our Paris headquarters when we return. Paris is the most beautiful and exciting of cities with spectacular art, incredible beauty, great shopping and fantastic food. The right location makes all of these accessible to the short term visitor and Le Walt's location does just that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IMOM67
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed three nights at the Le Walt from June 11th-14th. We loved the place. It is a nice botique hotel with 20 some rooms in the perfect location. There are cafe's a plenty just outside the door plus a grocery accross the street to get some wine, cheese snacks etc.... Rooms are very clean and modern. Free internet, comfortable beds, romms with french doors that open up to the street. We had two rooms one for us and one for the kids but the prices per room were great by Paris standards. There is also a metro station right outside the door and you can walk to the Eiffel from here as well, about 10 minutes but a very very nice wolk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mickey8
Reviews.Content: We chose Le Walt partly based on TA reviews. It's great, though rooms are small, but modern and comfortable. The street has a grocery store, brasseries, post office, Metro at the corner, etc., and in the heart of Paris. The staff are very helpful, friendly, and competent in English. I highly recommend this little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our perfect honeymoon hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Allisonnoel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Le Walt after reading many on-line reviews and finding a good deal on Expedia. We both agree that this was the perfect hotel to stay at for our honeymoon! Location: The Ecole Militaire metro was spitting distance from the front door which made traveling around Paris extremely convenient. The hotel is also a very short walk to the Eiffel tower and on the same street as cafes, a grocery store, a pastry shop and a bread shop. Everything we needed was always right there. So convenient! The Hotel and Staff: When we went in the hotel we were taken by the charm of the place and the very friendly woman at the front desk (Melanie). We had a very positive experience with all the staff at the hotel. They were so nice and always made sure we knew they were available to us. On one night the woman at the front desk gave us great advice as to where to get dinner and drinks. The Room: We were extremely impressed by the room! We were very very fortunate to get a room with an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower. Over our 4 day stay, we never got sick of this view....it was truly perfect! I think we took about 20 pictures of the view throughout our stay. The room was quaint and had everything you could possibly need, including a fridge, tv, in-room safe, closet and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was great and quite spacious. We especially loved the towel warmer. My husband and I had an extremely positive experience at Le Walt and would recommend it to anyone. I know where we will be staying again when next in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and modern, not much atmosphere but close to other places.”
Reviews.Author: Marshall100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for a number of attractions with the eiffel tower only a few minutes walk and 5 minutes In the other direction is the hotel de Invalides. The hotel is right next to the ecole militaire underground station which is great and easy for getting around the city. Our room on the 4th floor caught the top of the eiffel tower where we could view the twinkling lights and search lights at night. The sun also shone into the room in the afternoon and evening. We weren't booked in for breakfast, but probably saved quite a bit of money as a result. €20 per head, and there is a bakery a couple of doors down where you can get a couple of pastries for a couple of euros! We also didn't eat dinner or have drinks in the hotel, partly because it seemed expensive but also because it lacked atmosphere. At times it felt like we were the only people in the hotel. With a number of cafes on the door step this isn't really a problem. The room was very clean and modern. The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was good. My one criticism is that the website suggests internet access in the room, but the access isn't wifi. For Wifi you need to go to the bar. In the room you need a cable which isn't very handy if you are needing to access the internet on your smart phone. The computer access in reception is also very expensive at €4 for 15 minutes. The staff were generally polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kazryll1
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter, wonderful staff - very friendly and welcoming. Beautiful room, walking distance to the Eiffle Tower (recommend Jules Verne Restaurant). There are a number of excellent restaurants within walking distance, and Opera area is only two metro stops away from the hotel (metro station right outside the hotel). Having a late night in town, taxi max EUR 15.00 to bring you back. Train stop for Versailles only a five minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair price and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: travel1028
Reviews.Content: For Paris, this hotel is a very good price, considering it's stylish and in a good location with very friendly service. We didn't like the first room we were shown so we asked oif we could be moved and it was no problem. New room was a decent size with nice bed and stylish lighting. No matter who was on reception, they were always very friendly and helpful. Location right across the road from the Metro station was really handy too. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: freeholdFreehold
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hotel Le Walt We loved everything about the room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very updated. You can see the Eiffel Tower in a distance and is gorgeous when lit up at night. The hotel is in a great neighborhood with the metro very close. Our only complaint was that the concierges were not very friendly and at times had an attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: diva80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Walt for 2 nights for a short birthday break, and generally had a good stay. The hotel is slap bang outside Ecole Militaire Metro station (exit Duquesne) and is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, the Seine, etc so is very well located. There is a café/bar next door, a Carrefour mini supermarket opposite, and Rue Cler a couple of minutes walk away (with lots of cafes and market stalls), so food and drink is easy to find (you don’t want to spend it in the hotel on food and drink as you will get ripped off!). The hotel is a boutique hotel so is a bit on the small side, but is tasteful and decorated with class. Although not sure about the massive painting hanging above the bed (mine had one with a lady showing her boob) but could have been worse. The room was modern and clean, and was equipped with a flat screen TV and DVD player (which is good, as there are very limited English language channels). The bed is big and comfortable, and you have a little desk and lamps for adequate illumination. We had a superior room as we felt a standard room would be too small, and I'd say we were right as the room was spacious enough for us to be comfortable. I think a smaller room would have been okay for a couple of days, but we're glad we took a larger room. The shower is above the bath instead of separated which is fine as they're obviously short on space as its a small hotel. You are provided with nice L’Occitane toiletry products (shampoo, shower gel, body lotion, soap, shower cap, manicure kit, earbuds, cotton pads), hairdryer and pretty good quality towels. We weren’t given any slippers or bathrobes, which was surprising for a 4 star hotel. There is a minibar, which isn’t security chipped, so you can at least use it to put a few of your own items in if you so wish (I never take any items from minibars in hotels, unless I am really desperate!). We had an okay sleep, it is a little noisy on the main road in the weekday morning (Friday morning) but Saturday morning was a lot quieter. We had 2 main gripes from this trip…the first room we were put in, the air conditioning wasn’t working, it kept getting hotter instead of colder! This was even after we had been shown how to use it. Anyway, we requested another room instead, although we were asked if we would be okay with opening the windows instead (of course we weren’t okay with it, we’d paid for an air conditioned room and not to mention noise and pollution!!). We declined of course, and they put us in another room pretty much straightaway, which I was pleased about. The next room’s air conditioning was working, but still wouldn’t go as cold as we wanted, but it was much more bearable than the other room. Gripe resolved. Second gripe is that upon checking out, we were told we had taken breakfast in the hotel one morning. We were very surprised to hear this, as we had on both mornings gone out to have breakfast at somewhere more reasonably priced (hotel breakfast is a rip off!). The lady at the front desk showed us a breakfast slip saying that two people from our room number had breakfast, and that it was proof of us having breakfast so we’d have to pay. We weren’t having any of that, so we protested, and eventually, she went to ask the breakfast waitress whether she recognised our faces for having breakfast on the said morning. Luckily for us, she had not seen us (we’re probably the only Indian faces in the place, so easily recognisable), so we were finally off the hook. We think someone must have either given our room number by accident, or even on purpose. I think this hotel needs to ensure they ask people’s name with their room number or some other suitable method for checking breakfast entries, as their system obviously doesn’t work. Gripe resolved, but still a bit annoyed by it. All in all I would still recommend Le Walt as the price, location and comfort level is pretty good considering other places in Paris, but I don’t know if I would personally go there again, purely because of the two gripes listed above. Couple of tips for Paris (which you’ll have read in other TripAdvisor reviews no doubt!): - Best ice cream, Berthillon on Ile Saint Louis - Best hot chocolate (and pastries) at Angelina on Rue Rivoli (between Place de Concorde and Le Louvre). - Best falafel (and quick service) at L’As Du Fallafel (Rue des Roisiers near Saint Paul station) - Eiffel Tower at night has special sparkles for the first 5 minutes of every hour - Le Louvre museum free on 1st Sunday of the month, otherwise at reduced rate of 6 euros on Friday evening (6pm onwards) – otherwise normal entry is 9 euros 50 cents. - Watch out for scary men selling stuff near the Sacre Coeur, and be strong to say no and walk off!!

Reviews.Title: “A real find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SFWOxford
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Paris a few years ago whilst working for a travel company I know that hotels in Paris can be a bit hit and miss! Le Walt is the best hotel I have stayed in in Paris. The rooms are a good size, the bathrooms are great with L'Occitaine toiletries. The location is fabulous - a few minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine and in a great area for restaurants and shops and the metro is literally outside the door. We had a room overlooking the terrace and it was the quietest hotel room I have ever had in Paris - amazing! All the staff were friendly and efficient. Downside for us was the breakfast which at 19 Euros each was very expensive but there is a boulangerie about 100 yards down the street and a great supermarket opposite so we did a DIY breakfast on mornings 2 and 3. Le Sketch bistro in the Rue St Dominique was lovely and Rue Cler is a real typically Parisian shopping street. Le Walt really is a great find - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with views of the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: joolsverne5
Reviews.Content: We eventually found the Hotel de Walt after asking a couple of locals and walking up and down the Rue. The best metro to get off at is Ecole Militaire and it is a few yards away. (We got off at the wrong station!) The reception was very friendly and helpful, the young lady on the bar was extremely chatty and pleasant. The bar prices were, as to be expected quite high, so we didn't use this facility too often! The room was comfortable if a little compact. We'd mentioned an anniversary on booking with eurostar and found that we'd been upgraded to a superking bedroom (handy as we're both tall!). There was only one bathrobe, which wasn't rectified when mentioned at the reception, but not really a problem, so we didn't pursue it. The room was clean and the bathroom stocked with L'Occitane toiletries, hairdryer,etc. There was free internet station in the lobby, although I didn't get chance to use it. Location was great. It was about half a mile from the Eiffel Tower, which we reached at 9.30am and even then there was a queue to go up. The reception advised on a little street full of restaurants to visit in the evening, with reasonably priced food. The metro system was so efficient and cheap (go as far as you like for 1.6 euros) that it didn't matter that we weren't in the centre of Paris. Liked best: location and it was very quiet at night. Liked least: nothing really - we'd go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: Jess_and_Sami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Walt and had the most fabulous city break. The hotel is boutique and beautiful. The room was a great size, bed was really comfortable and it was extremely clean. and the service was really friendly and efficient. But the most amazing thing about the hotel is the location and the view. It is literally 5 minutes from the eiffel tower and Les Invalides, the metro is directly outside the front door and you can see the Eiffel tower from all the windows. There's great little supermarket across the street and all the surrounding streets are packed with chic little shops, delis, bakeries, cafes, florists and really good cheese and wine shops. We had dinner at Auberge Bressane 2mins down the street which the receptionist recommended it was sublime. Will definitely go back again. Romantic, stylish, convenient and with a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. What more could you want?!

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to tell you about Le Walt because I love it so much!”
Reviews.Author: Sworn2Fun
Reviews.Content: I don't want to review Le Walt, but since the secret is very apparently out I will say this: 1) It's in the 7th which is my very favorite part of Paris. It's where tourist becomes residential...there are real Parisians here. 2) You can see the Tour Eiffel from many rooms, which just never gets old 3) It's next door to my best friend's house (wait, you don't care about that) 4) It is NOT a "hotel du charme", it is quite modern, very boutiquey- but that means clean and comfy with modern bathrooms. 5) It is yards from the rue Cler which is ground zero for foodie visitors to paris. 6) They are SO nice here, just lovely, to Francophones and non-Francophones alike. 7)They make a mean cappuccino and bring it to your room and it feels like family...not room service. If you decide to book here, please check with me first ;-) I always want to be able to get a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Red034
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and we weren't disappointed. The Hotel has literally the best location. Located only a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and only a few steps to the Metro, which will take you anywhere in Paris. Across the road was a grocery store, specialised bakeries, chocolate shops and also a fresh food market Rue de Cler. The staff at the hotel were exceptional! They were friendly, helpful and were fluent in both English and French. The service was also great, and our room cleaned quickly every morning, whilst we were at breakfast. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Super Large room for a stand”
Reviews.Author: wir3
Reviews.Content: Room was incredible. Largest in Paris. Very good price and accomodations were superb. This place is so close to the Eifel tower that it takes literally 5 minutes of strolling to get there. Supermarket across the street has great food/snacks/and WINE! The best part is the BED. We have never slept better in any other hotel. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: discovery74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice. The metro is literally accross the street from the hotel. The staff at the front desk are super. They will accomodate your requests. The only thing I didn't like about my room was a bit of mold by the sink area and scratched marks on the floor. Otherwise, the bathroom and room were pretty clean. We stayed in room 103. I would definetelly recommend this hotel to a friend. The rates per night were super reasonable, particularly for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location, with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: janeandjen
Reviews.Content: Very nice small and friendly hotel, near to a metro station, and within a five minute walk of the Eiffel Tower. All of the staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly the lady serving breakfasts, and all spoke excellent English. The rooms were clean, bright and comfortable, as were the bathrooms. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel! Excellent Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: HMBParis
Reviews.Content: Chose Le Walt on the internet after following several links for other hotels recommended by TripAdvisor reviewers. Once you check their web site, you'll be hooked. Le Walt offered an incredible deal -- 3 nights for the price of 2. Since we needed two rooms, that was a God-send. We stayed 6 nights for the price of 4. The hotel is in one of the finest neighborhoods in Paris -- in the 7eme, a block from Rue Cler and just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, which is visible from the top rooms of the hotel. Le Walt is clean, the staff is friendly, and the rooms are well appointed and quite large (for Paris). It had AC (a must for summer in Paris) and was steps from the Ecole Militaire metro stop, which put us minutes away from anywhere in Paris. They offer a very nice breakfast, although we chose to eat breakfast on Rue Cler with its many cafes and patisseries. The staff was very nice, their English was superb, and they went out of their way to make recommendations, reservations, and be helpful. Would stay there again in a heartbeat! Tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfil place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrGriswold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at Le Walt in early July 2009. The hotel was situated 5 seconds from a metro entrance and 5 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower. The Invalides was also only 10 mins stroll away. There is a well equipped supermarket directly across the road, a bakery only two or three doors down and a plethora of cafes etc nearby. Upon arrival we were upgraded without requesting and welcomed by a very nice staff member. Our room was very nice with windows that opened out to a view of the street below. At night it could be a little noisy until about 11pm, but it never once stopped me from having a good nights sleep. The staff were very helpful in directing us to various places etc and assisting me to use the wi-fi in the lobby. I would highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy - never more!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mirin7
Reviews.Content: Hotel furniture was broken. Hairs in the bath-tub! Hotel staff was not professional. Recommendations by staff were inadequate. Bloody stains on bedspread!!! It was not in keeping with your 4 star system. We were extremely disappointed with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not as pleasant as the sister Hotel de Marquis, but perhaps a bad room!”
Reviews.Author: daburger
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at Le Walt as my usual hotel (the sister Hotel Du Marquis) was booked. The hotels are virtually identical - the same fixtures, fittings, toiletries etc. This hotel is consistenly more expensive, and I'm not sure why - it's a slightly better location and seemingly feels 'newer' but the rooms are the same size. My room, on the first floor, wasn't the greatest - over the courtyard (so could hear the people enjoying a drink etc) and the metro could be heard underneath - not a thundering noise, but enough to be heard when the TV is off and you're trying to fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location with a helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gibson89
Reviews.Content: Our stay here for our anniversary was wonderful. The hotel rooms in Paris can be very small, and while being small, our room was well appointed. The room was nicely decorated, as was the lobby. The staff was fantastic! They were so kind and helpful and their English made up for our lack of speaking French. Housekeeping did a great job every day. We were in room 102. It had 2 twin beds but they could be moved together. Its on the front side of the hotel, it can be a little loud, but my husband likes to have a little white noise while he sleeps. Plus walking and being on the go all day made us so tired, that eventhough we noticed the street noise, we slept really well.One afternoon there was a loud demonstration that marched by, but that only happened once and it was only for a few minutes in the afternoon. Really no big deal. The shower was fine,and had great water pressure with an adjustable shower head that actually was high enough for my 6' 4" husband. The partial glass shower door is common in Paris. Just put an extra towel beside the bath mat to catch tthe droplets and spray that get by the glass. Having a "nicer" metro stop just up the street and shops close by was really convenient. After going to the bustling, somewhat seedy Right Bank area for sightseeing, we were very glad to stay in this charming Left Bank area. We stayed 8 nights and enjoyed every minute! If you can stay a week or more I definately recommend it, you will be glad you weren't so rushed. But no matter what you need even more than a week to see all of Paris. We loved staying near the Eiffel and Invalides, plus being in the Rue Cler district was so quaint. We loved to stroll the streets in the morning and evening. We ate breakfast at the Cafe Du Marche everyday and had dinner at Ulysses (twice), Cafe Du Marche (1), Sud 7 (1), La Terrace(1). We loved the Rue Cler merchants, the nicest shopkeeper at the newstand helped us find the best metro/street map. We almost felt like we were living in Paris for the week. For those who have heard that Parisians are rude: Our entire trip was filled with wonderful experiences and the nicest people. Just be polite, learn a few phrases before you go. Remember to enjoy and not always be in such a hurry. Don't feel desperate just because you are somewhere unfamiliar. Believe me my French is very basic and everyone, from the subway employees, to musuem employees, to waitstaff at restuarants, even police officers we encountered at landmarks were so kind and patient. Even security and customs at CDG airport. My husband was very impressed, he only knows a few phrases that I taught him and he was treated just as nice everywhere. I recommend the French Phrase Book by Rick Steves. His book on Paris is quite good, also. Study these books and you will feel much better a day or two into the trip. I hope we are blessed with another chance to visit Paris and would stay in the same location and if possible the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kathandBert
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. All the staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. Their English was good. When we left, I inadvertantly left some jewelllery in a drawer in our room. The staff found the missing items and posted them back quickly and efficiently. The location was very good because it was next to the metro. We were also within walking distance of the Eiffel tower and the boats. We found that a day ticket on the bato-bus (hop on --hop off !)was a good value to see around. The Rue Cler across the road, was worth a visit and ' La Terrasse' on the corner was a good, reasonnably priced place to eat. We would certainly recommend and revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: madyak
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for a week whilst on a recent trip to Paris, I had picked it after reading the reviews on this site and was not disapointed. Firstly the hotel is pretty easy to get to from CDG airport requiring only 1 change on the metro and is pretty to close to the metro station itself. The staff at check in were all very friendly and helpful and the room was a decent size with some interesting art on the walls and huge windows giving me a good view of the Eiffel Tower. The bathroom was again a decent size and very clean. So despite being stuck in Paris for a week on my own I felt more than comfortable in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ganesha1959
Reviews.Content: I cannot compliment the staff at Hotel Le Walt enough for the wonderful stay I had over the New Year holiday. I was made to feel very welcome, greeted by name every time. The room was clean and quiet. And, the location is ideal. This will be my new regular place to stay in Paris. Why look for another?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great room, great staff, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: vreverdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Le Walt last January and was extremely pleased with my stay. I brought some clients and they were very pleased as well! The rooms are very comfortable and the staff both attentive and personable. It was a very refreshing experience, quite a departure from other experiences I had in similar priced hotels in Paris. The location was ideal, very close to the Eiffel tower. I would very highly recommend this place to anyone staying in Paris on business. I am planning a trip to Paris with my wife in early Spring and I will definitely stay at the Hotel Le Walt. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Nana_Yaw
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel. Cool artwork; nice touch. My girlfriend and I had a great time on a weekend away for my birthday. Handy for some of the major tourist attractions sites and a hop-skip and a jump from the subway so despite being quite a jaunt from 1" Arr. we were very close time-wise. Cost: Not extortionate in a major city. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, undercleaned”
Reviews.Author: gettingaround
Reviews.Content: aesthetically the hotel is ok and it is in quite a pleasant part of Paris but it was grubby - from the first impression, a dirty lilac doormat - with a not clean whiff in the lobby and also quite noisy with guests knocking on the wrong (my) door through the night and brazen about the disturbance. The bedding and curtains were clean but the bathroom less so. Furnishings like the door displayed the organic trace of previous occupants. The lavatory had not been properly cleaned for some considerable time and the tiles by the shower were grubby, with engrained mould in the grouting. The tiles on the walls were also not clean. Happily, opposite the hotel is a supermarket which sells bleach and other cleaning materials. The bathroom was not quite as daunting or whiffy after a bottle of bleach down the loo... Some hotels supply slippers and in others one leaves slippers that have become dirty. This definitely fell into the latter category: I simply do not understand the rave reviews others have given and did not feel able to risk the breakfast. I also do not agree that the staff were good.

Reviews.Title: “terrific! excellent”
Reviews.Author: anniep_italy
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel I've ever seen! The personnel was great, I was a single traveller and they treated me as one of them! They were so friendly and very very kind! The room was big and super clean! TERRIFIC! WONDERFUL STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Stroober
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is near the Eiffel tower but away from the tourist throngs. The staff were very friendly and helpful. would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, Perfect location, would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: MandMUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Walt for 3 nights in July for a long weekend, travelling via the Eurostar from London. We were slightly nervous about the standard of the hotel having heard some stories about Paris hotels being expensive yet a bit on the shabby side. Le Walt was neither of these, it was a small boutique hotel in an ideal location on the Left bank. We took the Metro from Gare du Nord - 1.5 euros each and the station (Ecole Militaire) is right outside the hotel. Our room was at the top with a great view of the E.Tower. It was on the small side, but very cosy. If you don't mind walking, you can walk to all the major sites from the hotel. There are restaurants/cafe's nearby, especially along Rue de Cler. There was an especially nice Italian restaurant just along from the hotel (come out of hotel and turn right) which although was a bit on the expensive side, served great food and good wine (£100 for 2 courses + bottle of wine) We would definately recommend to any of our friends and family looking for a weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LanierPrincess
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Rodin Musueum and Hotel des Invalides. Rooms are small but very nicely decorated with local artists creating all the paintings in the room and lobby. Bathrooms were spacious, small breakfast area and outdoor area to have breakfast or afternoon drinks. Excellant resturants within walking distance to the hotel. Great bakery two doors down for morning pastries or to grab a sandwich for the day. The Conceirges were very friendly and helpful with resturant suggestions and tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Le Walt”
Reviews.Author: DAD/BOB
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of again staying at the Hotel Le Walt in the 7th arrondissement in Paris. We have been there 4 times since 2004, and we have had an excellent experience every time. The hotel building was newly constructed in 2001 so it has modern safety features, good plumbing and wiring, and air conditioning. It is a 4 star hotel that specializes in taking care of English language visitors. All the staff speak good English. The rooms are lovely and are appointed with all the conveniences including a DVD player and internet connection. Some rooms have a view of the Eiffel tower and a small balcony. The hotel serves an excellent breakfast and has a full bar service. The decorations are charming, modern, and inviting. The location is superb -- the hotel is next to a metro stop, there are many restaurants near by, a supermarket and post office are across the street, and the famous rue Cler is 1 block away. The rue Cler is the archetype of the quaint shopping and eating street in Paris. The best part of the hotel is the staff. They are all competent, attentive, and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: wandertwins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at Le Walt for 5 nights/6 days...May 15th to May 20 and we absolutely enjoyed our stay! While I may be repeating some of the other reviews here, here's a breakdown of our experience: • it is located within a short walking distance to the Eiffel Tower • there is a Metro station just a few steps away from the front of the hotel...extremely convenient! • the breakfast buffet is not a huge spread by American standards, but it is more than adequate [ with scrambled eggs, sausages, croissants, danishes, bread, ham, cheese, cereal options, jam/jelly options, juice options, coffee options and i think a potato option as well] and for us, it was well worth the money since twice we got up early to enjoy the buffet at a leisurely pace before we headed out for the day...also, the ambiance of the dining area is such that we couldn't help but have a nice, relaxed breakfast experience • since it is located within an upscale residential area, there are plenty of very good brasseries, patisseries, cafes, and fromageries just steps from the hotel entrance • very close to the popular Rue Cler area • the room [and hotel in general] is extremely clean • the staff is kind and helpful, but not overly friendly • there is an option to buy time on their one computer [available 24hrs/day] for the internet but it is slow • the pillows are a little flimsy and flat • the walls and doors are solid...though we were on the bottom floor close to the patio we didn't have any problems with noise and slept soundly • bed is a little hard but not entirely uncomfortable • though we stayed for nearly a week, the small closet was not an issue because we both packed lightly Overall, we loved Le Walt and would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Mogo5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just beautiful all around but very expensive. It is in area 7 which makes it's location to everything excellent. The metro is just infront and very easy to use once you get the hang of it. Staff were nice and room was spotless everytime you came back to it. The toiliteries were also very nice. I booked through hotels.com and paid about $280 CDN/night - the hotel was advertising direct at 295Euros. There is a nice Boulanger Pattiser about 5 doors over with excellent and well priced bagettes and pastries but the service people in there are fairly rude, but we grabbed lunch there everyday anyways. Would stay again if my wallet allows - no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Pity about the Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: naaman60
Reviews.Content: Really great location, on top of the metro station, short walk to rue Cler, etc. Our discount rate room was nice with big windows, plenty of space, storage, desk and outlets for charging everything. Bathroom was plenty big as well and beautifully clean. The problems weren't huge but they were sufficiently annoying that I'd think twice about staying here again. First, the A/C controls don't work. We were very kindly given a demonstration of how to work the controls but the room did not cool down if we left the windows shut. We spoke to the front desk several times about this but the situation was never resolved. Also, housekeeping were stingy when it came to soap, shampoo etc. For a four star hotel and for the rate we paid, I shouldn't have to make a note to myself to ask for more soap and shampoo after the second day of a four day stay. For what we paid, we could do better in terms of service. Not sure if we could do better in terms of location. I hope this place improves, it has a lot going for it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lawyergirl25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Easter break for 2 nights. We booked late on Expedia so we paid more then what we maybe should have, but this hotel was coming out cheaper then some of the other offerings on Expedia. Location wise, this hotel is great. Directly next to metro station Ecole Militarie and just around the corner from Eiffel Tower. A walk to the Louvre and down the Seine took about 20 mins. The hotel definately very central without being right in the heart of the tourist places. Certainely the local bars and restaurants did not appear to be the tourist traps warned off. Some good restaurants near by as well as a supermarket over the way and a pattisiere a few doors down. We ate locally both nights and were very pleased. The restaurant directly next to the hotel (sorry name escapes me) served a great steak for 15Euro. We had a standard room overlooking the street. Yes it was a little noisy but it is a main road and the noise was not a problem for us. The bathroom was well appointed and the bed extremely comfortable. The room also had a flat screen TV and DVD player. Room very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff very friendly and polite and spoke good english. Check-in was not until 3pm but we arrived just after 1pm and shown straight to our room. Only negative comment would be was that the room was a little cold and took a good hour for the heating to get going though it was freezing outside. Also we really missed not having a hospitality tray. I don't know if this is the norm in Paris but a kettle and some tea/coffee would have been really appreciated and would be welcomed by other guests as well I'm sure. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and would advise others as well. It's a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall but also pricey for what you got!”
Reviews.Author: curehead
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because it looked decent and a bit more contemporary than some other 4-5 star hotels that appear to sometimes be quite dated, even if clean. Everything was good in terms of cleanliness and prompt service etc. We got one of the rooms on the top floor (601) with a nice view of the Eiffel tower. The room was not that big but ok for our needs and bathroom was relatively clean. The only downside was really that it felt a bit as if one was only paying for the decor. I mean, one small soap for two people is a bit tight and even more so if it is not replaced with a new one after the first day. Same for shower gel. I mean it does not cost much, and i appreciate hotels trying to avoid customers just bagging them every day but you should expect one soap per person at this room price. That was the only downside and it would have been nice to have breakfast included at this room price too although it was clear before that it wasn't and that it is pretty standard to have a room without breakfast. However I stayed at other hotels that are much better in terms of price for money, but in other cities, Lisbon, Brussels etc. Paris seems a bit more expensive. If that is acceptable to you, go ahead and book this one, as it is a nice small smart boutique hotel that your significant other should enjoy as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: benjonesOxford
Reviews.Content: We visited recently with our friends for a long weekend and thought the whole place was wonderful. The service was exceptional being friendly and fast but not at all intrusive. The hotel arranged flowers and champagne in our room prior to arrival and the bar, although small was very cosy and pleasant. The position was perfect with good restaurants close and the Eifel tower within an easy walk. A definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 2cents2travel
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and it will not be my last! When I do return, I will again stay at the Hotel Le Walt. Located in the 11th and across the street from the Metro (and the Eiffel Tower I might add!) it was a great place to center my stay in Paris. Such an easy trip by train from the airport, and within walking, Metro, or bus distance of everything. On top of that, the staff were very helpful and friendly, and the rooms (while not huge) , were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was spotless, modern, and decorated in Tiffany blue and white. While they do serve a breakfast, it appeared a bit pricey for what it was. I instead ate at the cafes and boulangeries on Rue Cler (a market street with wonderful cafes, shops, etc.) right next to the hotel. Also very convenient to have a Super Marche across the street to avoid the 10 Euro bottle of water from the mini-bar! Can't forget to mention our beautiful view of the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room through the 'Peter Pan" floor to ceiling windows.

Reviews.Title: “sooo cute!”
Reviews.Author: marie6613
Reviews.Content: one of the cutest boutique hotels in paris! i totally recommend staying here. Nice rooms and large bathrooms! very close to metro and clean part of paris.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: tayl9512
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Paris on either side of a trip to Provence. We stayed at the Le Walt first and another hotel in the Latin Quarter on the return. The LeWalt was truly a wonderful experience in every way. We arrived the day of a taxi strike and had to walk from Les Invalides entrace about 4 blocks to the hotel with our luggage in tow. At that point, we were about ready to drop, especially after the transatlantic fllight. The woman at the desk was wonderful. Just a charming person, very polite. Offered us a beverage, had our room ready and offered help with our luggage. The room was perfect. I had requested a nice room because it was a special event and was not disappointed. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower and the tree-lined streets around the hotel. The room was spotless, the bathroom beautiful and large by Paris standards. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. We had breakfast in the hotel every day, although it would have been easy to go a block and eat at any of the cafe's on Rue Cler and had a great meal. The proximity to the metro (right across the street) and many attractions and restaurants can't be beat. More than anything, though, the staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Charlotte, who helped us a lot, was great. She made dinner reservations for us at several wonderful little places not in the guide books. She helped book a tour for us. Called a cab when we needed one and loan us umbrellas when it rained. I would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy if on lower levels”
Reviews.Author: quarterlytraveller
Reviews.Content: We paid for a deluxe room but all rooms are "deluxe" to my knowledge. The other "superior" (cheaper) room is in the outside courtyard and is quite dark. Staff were totally policy driven. We couldn't sleep due to noise from down stairs and on complaining they lied by saying they had no other rooms left then eventually that we could move higher but would need to pay more. Our room looked like a disabled room with chips in the plaster. Staff chant bonjour with the most insincere smile you could imagine and were quite patronising. Our only experience with this attitude in Paris was unfortunately from this hotel. On the positive- the location was great. Recommend dont getting a cheap deal over the net as they will make you feel like you are not worthy of being there. All staff are very young and obviously inexperienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTX
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Walt is a brilliant little "boutique" hotel in a very convenient location (right next to the metro). The rooms were small (expected) and well fitted out. I think it has been recently refurbished. The bathroom was modern and very clean. We had an attic room which was really nice. The room was front facing and you could see the Eiffel Tour in the background. The reception/breakfast room was decorated in a very modern style and the staff were helpful and approachable. The buffet breakfast, however, was poor. A few dry pastries, slice of ham etc. We didn't mind as we ate out anyway! A good restaurant is Georges. It is a contemporary and trendy French/Asian fusion restaurant located on the top floor of the Centre Georges Pompidou (shopping centre). It is outside, so if the weather is unreliable then take/ wear something warm! It's worth a vist as the view of Paris is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful le Walt”
Reviews.Author: Danielle055
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull little hotel. Impeccably clean! Comfortable big beds; accommodating and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Option for the 7th”
Reviews.Author: BijouxButtercup
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Walt in mid July this summer. The staff was very helpful and accomodated all of our requests. The hotel itself has small rooms like many in Paris. Sound carries in the small hallways. I was awoken by other guests who were loud and partying at 2:00 a.m not once but several times as the door to the stairs kept opening and closing. The breakfast is very good and the coffee is excellent. They used to have a restaurant for dinner but no longer. As for location, in the 7th it's hard to beat. The Ecole Militaire Metro stop is right out of the front door. Ask for a courtyard room. Rooms on busy Le Motte Piquet may have late night street noise from the bar next door.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok for a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Poelse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon in May and had in our booking stated, that it was in fact - a honeymoon. When we arrived, there was no bottle of anything to congratulate us, no greetings, no nothing. Well, ok, that was our problem, and since the supermarkets are only on the other side of the road, we managed to pamper ourselves nicely. I had specified in my booking, that we wanted a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower which we got.
