But since another guest had booked the same room in advance, we had to move from that room to another facing the backyard. And after one night, we moved back again, since the room with a view was in fact what we wanted. And all in all we had a nice stay, but the staff seemed to be annoyed with us and on the brink of telling us off. We are reasonable people and gladly carried our suitcases from room to room - and left everything as tidy as we could, when we changed rooms. Therefore: If you want a honeymoon in a romantic setting with nice people treating you as you are actually on the best holiday of your life - then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeancovergirl
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to metro, restaurants,supermarket, Eiffel tower, Seine river (for boat trips). Other attractions easy to reach by metro or taxi. Very clean, comfortable and modern property (including rooms). I stayed on the third floor with a courtyard view, quiet room. Pleasant and helpful staff. My only complaints are: The room had a smokey smell even though I requested a non-smoking room (I could have asked for another room but did not bother since I was permitted to check in early and I was also tired from traveling since the day before). There were no iron and board in the room, you'll have to request them and the maids usually take them away when they tidy up. Nevertheless, I was pleased with my choice of hotel and will definitely stay there again. Linda Antigua & Barbuda.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique”
Reviews.Author: TanyaP
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in the 7th. Great location near three nice cafes and shopping. Metro stop is two businesses down. Charming Rue Clare is 1/2 block away. Beautiful boutique hotel, small but elegant. Our room was lovely and the bath first-rate. Good storage in the bath; a little less in the bedroom, but we still enjoyed it. Very good lighting in room & bath. Staff were all friendly and very helpful. Went from here to the Lutetia in St. Germain-des-Pres to join friends. We much prefer the ambiance of the Le Walt. And, compared to rates at Lutetia, Le Walt's a good value in a quieter neighborhood..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Californium
Reviews.Content: Saw some of the bad reviews on Trip adviser, but was pressed for time and Le Walt was one of few with available rooms- so took a chance. Got a superior room, but I think it was really meant for disabled people because the bedroom itself was small but the bathroom very large (for the turning radius of a wheelchair) and it was ground floor. However, it was comfortable and quiet. The breakfast at the Le Walt was very good. The best thing about this place is the location- right off a major metro station and could walk to the Rue Cler district so highly acclaimed by Rick Steves (it is actually pretty nice). I found the staff at the Le Walt very professional and pleasant. It is a boutique hotel and has that feel. A mix of nationalities staying here: American, Brits, Chinese, and yes- even French. Bathrooms are modern as shown in photos. There was one bad point- we found a cockroach in the bathroom one night. And on the second night. However, I think this is something the smaller hotels are constantly battling in any big city at certain points in time: too close to adjacent restaurants and food. Thus I give them 3 points (neutral/average) instead of Above average.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service, in a great area”
Reviews.Author: cnchapman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Le Walt for 7 nights in a deluxe room on the 6th floor. The hotel was a delight -- spotlessly clean, very comfortable bed, and a decent-sized room (for Paris). This was by far the best of four hotels I've visited in Paris, and would be my first choice for future visits. We were there on business (me) and vacation (my wife) and the hotel served very nicely for both purposes. Our room was very quiet and clean, with an armoire, comfortable bed, desk, small table, 2 chairs, and a bathroom with shower/bath combination. Because we were on the top floor, the ceiling was slanted near the wall, which cut a bit into headroom but provided nice dormer windows. Bathroom was very clean and functional, but the shower/bath was a little cramped and tended to splash water around (there was no shower curtain). As for room quiet, I'd note two things. First, the hotel is on a relatively busy street (Avenue de la Motte-Piquet) and rooms are on either the street side or back side facing a courtyard and the backs of apartments. Our room was on the back side, which we loved -- there was no traffic noise and it was very nice to feel "at home" by seeing people in the other apartments. On the street side, on the other hand, the higher-floor rooms would have views of the Eiffel Tower. So there's a tradeoff there. Second, because the hotel is over a Metro station, there was occasional rumbling from trains. Those did not bother us at all, but light sleepers on lower floors might notice them. The area was fantastically convenient, both for foot travelers (like us) and for those who prefer public transportation. For foot travelers, its location in the 7th puts it within 30 minutes of the Champs-Elysee, Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel Tower, Invalides, and just a little longer to Latin Quarter and Notre Dame. For those who prefer less walking, there is a Metro stop literally 20 yards from the hotel, and you can get almost anywhere in the central part of Paris within 20 minutes. There is also a taxi stand around the corner. Nearby Rue Cler is a wonderful market area with many shops and restaurants. Wonderful, that is, if it were not somewhat overrun by tourists thanks to its being featured in a guide book. Still, it was very convenient for breakfast, wines, cheese, delightful restaurants, etc. I'd like to correct a couple of misperceptions that appeared in other reviews. First, the hotel does have internet access in the rooms. In fact, it is free access, through an ethernet port (requires a cable, available from the front desk). WiFi is only available in the lobby (for a fee). As long as you have an ethernet port, you will be OK. Second, the devices in the bathrooms are electric radiators, not towel warmers. Of course one can use them for towel warming, but that's not the primary purpose. The only thing that did not live up to expectations was laundry service. It was expensive (e.g., 9 euros to do a shirt), wasn't available on Sunday or Monday, and my pants came back with spots (which the hotel happily fixed, but took another day). I'd recommend to seek out another laundry service; there are several we saw nearby when walking around. Finally, the hotel had excellent service. Front desk and most other personnel were fluent in English. I especially appreciated the concierge service provided, which helped us make reservations at several restaurants (which is usually possible to do in English, but we were making them well in advance). All in all, the Le Walt was a great experience and we found it to be a good value -- expensive like everything in Paris, but well worth it. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jacob555
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel due to the consistant comments from tripadvisor and were not let down at all! The Hotel is small yet very well decorated, rooms are very clean with lovely features and bathrooms. We had a room on the 6th floor with view of eiffel tower which was nice yet not a must. We walked to all attractions from the hotel and there is an amazing street very close to the hotel which has fantastic and well priced food all the way down it (market style) ranging from cheese's to freshly made cakes, chocolate and hot meals, ther smells were fantastic. We found beer hard to come by under 5Euros for a half! which was a shock wine also quite expensive in the bistros(ranging from 11-25euros) as you could by the same stuff from the supermarket opposite the hotel for 4euros!!! Sacre Coeur catherdral is a must - a trek from the hotel yet views are fantastic also we really enjoyed the Louvre. Anyone going to this hotel will not be dissappointed at all unless you are on a budget as we found Paris expensive to eat and drink in yet the attractions were very reasonable. Tip of the day is the Louvre is free every 1st Sunday of the month we were lucky enough to go at this time. Overall, a fantastic trip would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyland
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Walt and I have to say, it does exactly what it says on the tin. The photos I had seen were a true reflection of what I got. OK, so the rooms are quite small but if you're after a nice room and hotel that has a boutique feel to it, you can't go wrong with this hotel. It's very decent and while it may not rival Hotel Costes and the other legandary Paris hotels, this really is a little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: getmeoutofhere2007
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked our Paris trip through the Eurostar website about a month in advance as we were travelling the day after Valentines day. Our hotel check in time was at 2o'clock and we arrived 15 minutes early, and as we were early we were given a choice of two rooms and we were shown both rooms before we made a decision.....Result....we choose the slightly smaller room on the 6th floor as it had a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower....The room was brilliant and nicely decorated.....the webiste really doesn't do it any justice..the bathroom was a fantastic size and has everything you could need. We were very happy with our choice of hotel, it was in the perfect location and the metro station was right outside the front door so we found the hotel very easily ! The only thing missing from the room was tea facilities, this being our first trip to paris we didn't relise this wouldn't be supplied and if you order tea at breakfast make sure you ask for it with milk!!! All in all we had a fantastric trip !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GreatButty
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from two days in Paris and stayed at this Hotel based upon the consistent good comments on Trip Advisor, plus the recommendation from Trip Advisor in their PDF on Paris. The location is good, the Eiffel Tower is 10 minutes walk away and you can walk to all the main locations such as the Arc De Triomphe, Louvre and Notre Dame. The area is lively but residential which we liked. We had lunch one day and dinner another in a couple of the nearby Restuarants (one of which was the Auberge) which was really good and we felt we got a better deal than the poor quality of meals the Resturants that cater for tourists tend to produce. In terms of using the Metro, though right outside the Hotel we actually walked everywhere. The Hotel itself is small but quaint, modern and well decorated and the rooms though indeed small are large enough to do the job and were well appointed and clean, so we were very happy with what we had. We were on the 5th floor but did not have a few of the Eiffel Tower, not that we were particualrly bothered. On the negative, alchloic drinks in the hotel cost a fortune, a double Jack Daniels is 21 Euros!!! The first evening we had tickets for the Moulin Rouge, the show was fantastic though the food was abismal, but we wern't that suprised. Also our seats were right on the front row, so we were as good as on the Stage which concerned me, however they turned out fine in the end, though we'd have preffered to be at least half a dozen rows back. Other areas of interest, the Eiffel Tower is of course a must, if you've not been, queues were not too bad, probably took an hour to get in. We didn't realise you could go to the Top of the Arc De Triomphe so that was a pleasant surpise and gave great views of the City. We also went to the Louvre, which was excellant, though it's a little on the large side, they have 35,000 works and the place is so vast they all blend in to one and as for finding the exit, good luck! Tips: Watch the Taxi drivers, we got charged 45 Euros to get from the Gard Du Nord to the Hotel, on the return trip it was just 15 Euros. Also on going to the Moulin Rouge we were charged 20 Euros though the return journey was only 10. The only other real negative in Paris is that drinking out is very expensive, a beer can range from 5 Euros to 8 Euros for half a pint and shots around the same price, though generally wine is cheaper, more like 3.5 Euros a 25 CL glass. Overall we had a great time in Paris and Le Walt was a Hotel which we'd recommend and stay in again. Price wise we booked through the Hotel directly and got a rate at 225 Euros a night (InWood Hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Very Kind and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: SethPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Le Walt for three nights from January 19-22, 2007. I booked the hotel based on Tripadvisor. The pictures were accurate. The hotel was very quiet, especially if you get a room in the back by the garden. The staff was superb and very kind. Helped with restaurant reservations and went as far as giving printed maps to help find restaurant. They were concerned when our shuttle to the airport had not arrived and would have called for us if we wanted. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and it was just fine. I would repeat this way as you can save money for more expensive dinner. The Metro is great, so close to hotel and the entire metro system was very easy to get around, if you are there more than 2 days I would by a multiple day pass which gets you on any metro for one lump sum price. The metro comes every 2-5 minutes and while the stops may seem far away, they are actually very close, 20-25 minutes to go from one end to the other. Get a museum pass also, saves alot of money. For its class rating Hotel Le Walt was on top of the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: Shay007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Walt for 7 nights last October. It is indeed a fine Hotel with beautifully decorated rooms, a very pleasant staff and a fine 7th district location - close enough to most attractions and night life sites but still in a relatively quiet residential area. Still, at 275 Euro a night one might expect a slightly larger room. for 2 people staying 7 nights in Paris and carrying lagguage accordingly we had quite a challenge finding room for our staff and our suitcases. It is correct that Paris hotel rooms are amongst the smallest in the world and yet if you don't travel very lightly I'd consider another location. As far as the staff is concerned they were very willing and available but don't expect them to do anything real for you like getting a taxi at rush our or reservations at a popular restaurant. So, if you travel lightly and look for elegant design and very simple comfort - go for Le Walt. otherwise, either spend more on finer hotel or look for other boutique hotels offering more than big pictures on the room wall.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: para911
Reviews.Content: Ahhh Paris.... My partner and I just got back from our honeymoon. A week in Amsterdam and a week in Paris. This hotel is the absolute best! Just a few minutes walk to the Eiffel tower park, metro stop just outside the hotel, and tons of little cafes are within a few minutes walk in this wonderful neighborhood. I asked for a room with a view and got room 502. This room is on the top floor of the hotel and has a narrow balcony that can be accessed from the bathroom and the bedroom. The Eiffel tower (top half) is visible from the bed.... very romantic. The rooms are small but nicely appointed and the staff are THE best. The 13 euro breakfast was OK, not what Americans are used too.... but thats why everyone is skinny in Europe. The market across the street was great for baguette sandwiches, pasteries, fresh fruits and drinks. Free internet allowed me to email some of the hundreds of photos I took in both Amsterdam and Paris. If this hotel is on your short list of places to stay, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAX1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, great service, clean and right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and the Metro Stn "Ecole Militaire" and great restaurants. At the time of booking we asked for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower (Room 402) you cannot see the whole tower from ANY room in the hotel - but get a good view of the top of it and it is very pretty at night when it has the lights on. If you want a view of the tower and the street (I feel these are the best rooms) be sure to ask when you book to avoid disapointment. I plan to go back to Paris in the summer time and will be staying at this hotel for sure, I think it is great value and staff are friendly and helpful, English is spoken very well by the people on the desk and the hotel is so well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMU
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Walt is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and just 2 blocks from Rue Cler (high-end food market), w/ the Ecole Militaire Metro at the end of the block. It's a sweet little hotel, w/ personable service. Our room was next to the court yard, which was quiet and private. The room was much smaller than what we expected, but the bathroom was a good size. The breakfast included wonderful mini croissants and other pastries , fresh fruit salad, various cold cuts and cheese. It's a bit pricey for the hotel room size, but if you want a hotel that is new, clean, modern and personable it's definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Le Walt - C'est Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: KingOfTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Le Walt was simply fantastic!! The decor, the location, the ambience, and above all else the staff - were amazing! The rooms and lobby area looked good on the site but they were ten times better in actuality. the cortyard area where you could sit and sip Champagne was perfect in the July sun and got our 5 day break off to a wonderfull start. the rest of our stay was beyoind comfortable in the wwell appointed rooms with everything you needed really. the location was such that you could walk to the Champs Elysee within a leisurely 10 minutes (via Les Invalides) past some lovely bars and restaurants. You could also be in St Germain on foot within 15 mins. My gretaest praise is reserved for the staff - from check in to check out they were simply the best. Always friendly - initiatinmg conversatiomn in the morning - and always helpfull. Special mention has to go to the night manager Rashid who put uo with us until late in the night on our return from partyiung ( We were in paris celebrating a birthday). I would go again and agian to Le Walt and may just have finally found my Paris Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New and good location”
Reviews.Author: Kallang
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the top floor room facing the Eiffel Tower. You can see the top half of the Tower which has a light show on the hour at night. The room is small but modern. The bathroom is a nice size. There is market street opposite where you can get great French food. The room service food is limited and quite bad: reheated pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: howl
Reviews.Content: Situated almost directly above the Ecole Militaire Metro station, and 10-15 minutes' walk from the Eiffel Tower, Hotel le Walt provides easy access to the Paris sights. The hotel is in something of a cafe quarter, with plenty of options for eating and drinking, inside and out. At the Eiffel Tower, there is a Batobus stop, which will take you along the Seine to a number of the significant tourist spots. The hotel itself was sleek and clean, though our room was particularly small. We were put in a room at the back of the hotel, so did not benefit from a view of the tower, but perhaps had a bit less noise from the street outside. The back rooms are overlooked by a number of other buildings, so you'll need to keep the net curtains closed if you want privacy. In the room, there was a TV with numerous channels, including CNBC and BBC World, a DVD/CD player, a minibar/fridge and a safe. The minibar is big enough for you to put some of your own drinks/food in, and there's a supermarket across the road from the hotel. The bathroom was very modern, but had no shower curtain, resulting in a frequently wet floor. There were only four rooms on our floor (I think this is the case on all floors), so you don't get much noise from the corridor or the lift. The bar drinks were fairly expensive, but no worse than many bars in the area. Overall, Hotel le Walt was very well located, in what seemed to be a classy and pleasant area of the city. There were barriers surrounding holes in the pavement outside the hotel, but during our stay in mid-September, no work was being carried out. Whether or not the hotel is worth the rather high price, is a moot point. As it gives you easy access to the Metro system, Batobus and local eateries, while providing clean, comfortable sleeping accommodation, I'd say it's just about worth the money. Had it been 50 Euros cheaper, I'd recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, coming back”
Reviews.Author: bpinch
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation ever........... Staff was great, room was great, towels changed everyday, very clean room and made up everyday,,,,,,,we are going back.......... And don't be scared to drive we did, just get a neverlost navigation system and programme it and off you go We will be touring around next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: maltese_falcons
Reviews.Content: Visited Le Walt in late August for our honeymoon and we couldn't have picked a better place for it's cozy contemporary atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff, and a terrific location to the metro and Eiffel tower. We stayed in room 603 which is fairly sized and extremely clean. Only about 25 rooms in the entire hotel so you really feel like the staff know you and try to make every effort to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Ecole Militaire Metro station is directly in front of the hotel which links you to any major attraction and to the RER's. Would definitely return for a visit and would recommend this to any traveller willing to spend a little more for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: divasumner
Reviews.Content: brilliant- we were gretted by a very helpfull receptionist who helped us make restaurant reservations. I would recommend dinner at night on the boat. just a short walk from hotel. we were offered two bedrooms to choice from one large one or a smaller room but with a view. we went for larger room. great location, i didnt think it was cheap about £200 but then i dont know the price of others in the centre we would diff stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Le Walt”
Reviews.Author: KimMcDonald
Reviews.Content: Cannot speak highly enough of the hotel and it's staff. A week at the Le Walt was memorable for the convenient and accessible location, presentation and attention to detail of the hotel and the friendly and obliging staff. Nothing was too much trouble. Now one could make the usual comments about room size, but remembere this is Paris, not Hong Kong. Even then I have no complaints. I apologise if this is sounding a bit like a commercial, but it really is a good spot and if you like the Left Bank, and the 7th e particularly, I thoroughly recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel: great location”
Reviews.Author: Scottigal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days in Paris. This hotel is easy to reach from C De G: Roissy bus to Opera ( 8.50 euros) then a few stops in the metro to Ecole Militaire. The metro exit is right beside the hotel. The accommodation is clean and comfortableand the breakfast is fresh and good value for money though the staff dont seem to mind if guests 'do their own thing'. We had a lovely room on 5th floor and enjoyed the twinkling lights that appear on the Eiffel Tower at 10 and 11pm: they may appear later but we were fast asleep in the comfy bed! The bathroom is a decent size and has good facilities: bath and shower and a mirror with a light. The only problem we experienced was the lack of the early morning alarm call and early breakfast we arranged for the day we needed to leave the hotel early. The location is superb for sight seeing and there are loads of local food shops in Rue Cler which also has a market during other months. The surrounding area abounds with good restaurants offering food at a range of prices. We've visited Paris a few times now and we're glad to say the city is alive and well in August and we would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: California_Grown
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about this hotel. When we arrived we requested a romantic room with a view of the effiel tower...we got it. 5th floor, 2 balconies and a great view. 1/2 of the rooms in the hotel have a great view and many have balconies. The girls at the front desk were so sweet and extremely friendly. They helped us out with transportations, dinner reservations, getting us plug adapters Best part...the room and location.. It had an amazing view with 2 balconies! It was a great size for 2 with a very comfy bed and was very very clean! Don't worry about the pictures above the bed, they are a great touch and won't affect "romance" at all. Then there is the location. 5 minute walk to the effiel tower. About a 20 second walk to the metro station. Nice supermarket across the street, many little places to eat all within 1-2 minutes. Pros: location, staff, rooms were beautiful, free safe, view, cleanliness Cons: expensive internet, doors don't always close behind you, no conditioner, no large cabinets for clothing We will definitely stay there again. We loved sitting in bed at night and watch the dazzling show of the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele2
Reviews.Content: After having travelled on the Eurostar from Waterloo we found it easy to get to the hotel on the underground system. The hotel is just across the road from the train station. It is an excellent location for exploring the sites of Paris, and although we purchased train tickets for the weekend we ended up walking everywhere as all the sights are in walking distance. Great view of the Effiel tower from our window which sparkles at night. Nice area. Nice room and bathroom. Friendly and helpful staff. Would definately go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel; But Beware”
Reviews.Author: gooseegg
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel in July. It was terrific- nice, clean rooms, large bathrooms, convenient to the Metro, and a view of the Eiffel Tower. The staff was very friendly and willingly helped us with restaurant reservations and other recommendations. The area is nice too- good bakery for breakfast nearby (no need to have the overpriced hotel breakfast), and a street called Rue Cle a short distance away that has a traditional feel to it. Now the bad part. We made the reservation 9 months in advance for four nights. We paid in full as we were required to do and purchased cancellation insurance. After our itinerary changed we notified the hotel and cancelled one night of our stay- this occurred several months in advance of our arrival. We were assured that we would receive a credit for the cancelled night, which we did not receive before our arrival. Upon arrival and check-in we spoke at length to the hotel staff, who again assured us that we would receive a credit. Now, more than a month after our stay we still have received nothing. We are out almost $550 (it was for 2 rooms), so this is not insignificant. Bottom line- this is a nice hotel, but beware if you think your plans could change. They seem unwilling to honor their own cancellation insurance and refund policies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoodyMember
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site were right! We stayed at Le Walt for 4 days in July and were very happy with the hotel, the staff and location. The hotel is extremely convenient for the metro, a stroll to the Eiffel Tower or for local restaurants. The staff was excellent - both very friendly and helpful. The hotel and room was spacious enough (not huge, but good) and very clean. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased as punch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Walt was pretty good compared to some of the horror stories we had heard. We stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon European Tour and we were pleased. The staff was very courteous and spoke english well. This was a plus for us since neither of us spoke French. Our room was a deluxe king on the 5th floor facing the Eiffel Tower. The view of the tower was only the middle to top but it was very romantic when the lights started to shimmer. The room also had three balconies and this made the small room even better. The room was very cozy. The staff were very nice and provided us with a lot of information and even placed reservations for us. They made our stay hassle free. I would recommend and stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “lune de miel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in Paris once before this, at the Campanile on Boulevard Berthier, so Le Walt was a step up for us as we wanted to treat ourselves this time, with it being our honeymoon. We were very pleasantly surprised. I'd mailed ahead and told them it was our honeymoon and that we wanted a room with a view of the tower. For some reason (even though I'd given our visa card number) they would only say they would do their best, they didn't guarantee us a tower view. We did actually get room 601 which has a really good view of the tower and was perfect for seeing the fireworks on the 14th! There are numerous places to eat in the area, there is a supermarket over the road so take your kettle so you can have coffee in your room. There is a Boulanger a few doors up if you decided to buy croissants, baguettes, eclairs etc and the metro is literally right outside. As the breakfast in the hotel was 13€ a piece for just a continental style buffet breakfast, we thought we’d head out and see if we could find somewhere cheaper. To be honest, you’ll be hard pressed to find a cheaper breakfast unless you buy croissants yourself from the Boulanger or supermarket (which we did do) they are about 77cents each. We brought our own coffee, tea bags and a kettle and we got milk from the supermarket across the road from our hotel. We really did make a good choice of hotels, all the amenities right on the doorstep! We did eat breakfast in the hotel on the last day though for convenience and it was very good; fruit juice, coffee, cake, rolls, croissants, pain au chocolat, cereals, cold meats and cheeses (as much as you like, buffet style). That would fill you up til dinner time to be honest. So, again, you decide really. The room was beautifully decorated and immaculate with a big bath and a shower and clean towels every day. The staff are friendly and helpful. The room next door seemed to enjoy scraping their furniture across the floor (wooden floors) in the early hours, which was a bit annoying and we could even hear them walking around and lifting their loo seat so the soundproofing btwn rooms is not very good. The hotel is on a busy road so there is some traffic noise but that's the price you pay to be in a prime location I suppose. It's not too bad though. My only criticism would be that they didn't mention our honeymoon or congratulate us when we got there, a token gift or a card in the room would have made our stay a 10 out of 10. Just that little personal touch would have made such a difference. As it is, I'll give them a 9 out of 10 and would consider staying here again. A full review of our trip will eventually go on my web site if you want more in depth info, please go here http://homepage.ntlworld.com/ian.teeling/ but it will take me a few weeks to write it! :0)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Gti59
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all! Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. I had a good deal through Bancotel booked some months ago (regular rates can reach 300 euros??). Asked me 80 euros to add a roll away bed for my son of 11 years old. Completely crazy! Of course I said no! The location is pefect next to the Metro but it is so close that even on the fourth floor you can feel the vibrations. There are plenty of bars & restaurants in the vicinity but it is quite expensive (8 euros for a 500ml beer) . The 4th floor room was well appointed but very small. You can get a continental breakfast for an extra 13 euros. Not a good deal at all. Anyway there is plenty of food available around and a grocery just in face. I probably wouldnt stay here again I know there are better hotels in Paris for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But.....................”
Reviews.Author: MELSY
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I managed to get a good deal through Expedia booked some months ago as we had got tickets for the Robbie Williams concert. The location isnt bad-right next to the Metro. There are plenty of bars & restaurants in the vicinity but we found the food quite "samey" & not very adventurous-there were some better restaurants in & around Notre Dame. The 5th floor room was well appointed but very small & we had a superior room so I dread to think what the others were like!! There doesnt appear to be a restaurant serving dinner-although you can get a continental breakfast for an extortionate price! A word of warning if you use the mini bar keep a record of what you use-the reception tried to claim we had various items!! I probably wouldnt stay here again I know there are better hotels in Paris for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyriend and I decided Paris would be our first trip together in July 2005. Therefore, we wanted it to be perfect. We were so excited. My boyfriend had served as a Marine guard at the Embassy some years earlier, so he could speak French and was familiar with some areas. This made me feel very comfortable visiting another country. We did a lot of research on hotels. The Hotel Le Walt was one of our favorites. The reviews and pictures from this site assisted us in chosing Hotel Le Walt. I must say the pictures were accurate. Once we arrived we realized that this was a great location. It was just minutes from fine restaurants, tourist sites, ie. Invalides and other great points of interest, and also the Metro station. The room was tastefully adorned with modern furniture and a beautiful piece of art. Of course, it wasn't the standard american size room, but still was comfortable enough for the two of us. We actually enjoyed the closeness. The bathroom was quite different from what we're used to, no shower curtain. It felt good to be in Paris and experience their way of life. I would suggest that you take along washcloths. They only provide hand and body towels. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed late night chats with the bartender in the lobby bar. With the Metro station being just across the street we were able to enjoy sleeping in some mornings, even my early bird boyfriend, and still had time for site seeing. We often took late night walks to the Eifel Tower. The light shows were magnificent. This was a very nice hotel and the price was even better. When we revisit Paris we will definitely choose the Hotel Le Walt, again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alanber
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Le Walt for four nights from May 18th to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary.The location for the Effiel tower and the host of galleries in Paris was unbeatable and the selection of local shops and restaurants was diverse and well priced.The hotel itself was excellent and the staff very friendly and approachable and although not the cheapest in Paris we found the room good value and the decor was a conversation piece since each room was indeed different.Having visited Paris often and stayed at many hotels we will be back soon to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Walt”
Reviews.Author: KristaInLondon
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris hotels at least once every three weeks. I'm always on the lookout for a new place. My budget is always under 150 gbp or about $275 usd these days. At about 140ish gbp a night, I was extremely pleased with Le Walt. 1. The ground floor is very cute. There's the check-in desk, the bar, and the breakfast area. The bar isn't really a staffed bar, but whoever is working the front desk will be happy to grab you a glass of wine--at a decent price. 5.50 euros. I've stayed at other Paris hotels where the wine was more like 8 euros a glass. There's not a whole lot of comfy seating in the bar area, but you can take over the breakfast area, no problem. Pretty curtains break up the area. 2. Breakfast is 13 euros, but my experience tells me this is a better-than-average breakfast. There are croissants, pan au chocolate, yogurt, ham, salami, and cheese. And cereal. And juice. And the famous french-press coffee. So while it seems super-expensive, I've certainly been places where they charged 13 euros just for the croissant and coffee. 3. There's free Internet in the rooms. You might want to bring a LAN-cord. But otherwise, no expensive wireless or dial-in service. 4. There's room service, if you want it. I didn't try it, but it looks fun and varied. 5. There's a minibar. Decent selection of all the regulars. 6. Great bath products. Particularly a loofah, Nice touch. Mirror over sink has that automatic defogger thing. 7. Wood floors in the rooms. 8. Super close to the metro. 9. View of the Eifel Tower from my room. Granted just the tippy top, but it was a nice surprise. 10. Awesome courtyard. I can imagine that breakfast/drinks in July/August here would be wonderful. Very peaceful. 11. A real bed. Not overly slept in. Maybe just a little. I've been in worse. (How come after sleeping on the same mattress for > 5 years, my mattress at home never feels like a hotel mattress?) 12. OK, last point--free umbrellas at the front desk. It was raining when I went out to dinner last night. The Verdict: I'll be back. Up there with the Hotel Duret (still my fave), thanks to TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: BE64
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel, we were a party of eight Mums away for the weekend, we could not find fault with this hotel. It was in a lovely area, just next door to the Metro. The rooms of the hotel were superb, you couldn,t wish for more. They were very clean and plenty of room, well decorated with everything you need. The staff were an abolute delight, always friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again, I have stayed in many hotels in Paris before (large and small) and this was by far my favourite. Also we found the breakfast to be very good, plenty of choice and we all thought it was very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wife was happy!”
Reviews.Author: HJG
Reviews.Content: Perfect 7th district location. If you want to be where a little more action is, try the Saint Germine area. Hotel was as advertised. Clean, modern with friendly staff. Had a front facing room on the 4th floor overlooking the market and a hint of the Eifel tower. Can here the rumble of the metro, so if you are noise sensitive, suggest a higher rear room or different hotel. We were upgraded upon arrival. Did not try the buffet as Rue Clar and many pastry shops were very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: L6Traveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at Le Walt. We did a ton of research on hotels in Paris before finally deciding on this one. From the moment you first walk into the boutique hotel, you know that you're in for a treat. The lobby is quaint and stylish, with a great aromatherapy-type scent. The rooms would best be described as "modern-classic". The color pallette and fixtures are very cutting edge, but they are offset by classic touches like a large painting for the headboard and hardwood (laminate) floors. The style was a perfect compromise, as I prefer modern and my wife prefers traditional. As for location, it's fairly close to everything, and just steps from a Metro stop. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, although only some of the rooms offer this view. Even if you don't get a view it's still great. The young managers were extremely friendly and always eager to assist. Since it's a small property, you get a nice personal touch that you wouldn't receive at a larger hotel. There are tons of restaraunts right around the hotel, and the area is very safe. Only a few very minor drawbacks: 1. We had to request an iron and ironing board, as it's not in the room normally 2. No coffee maker in the room 3. Only a couple of restaurant menus for review at the front desk, would have preferred more selections of recommended locations. For the money, it's probably one of the better hotels in Paris. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: baltorich
Reviews.Content: Le Walt is a very nice boutique hotel in a convenient location with an accommodating staff. The room was nicely sized (for Paris) with a view of the top of the Eiffel tower and a beautiful bathroom. The metro stops right outside the entrance (stop: Ecole Militaire), which is ideal, and their are several neighborhood bistros and cafes right nearby. It's not a hot spot at night, so if you're looking for that, try another area, but it's beautiful and quiet and a nice stroll to the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast was fine - but we liked the breakfast in the bustling cafe across the street even more. The staff made all the reservations for everything we asked in a very prompt manner and they were all so pleasant. It's not a bargain, but it was very comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel during Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: buckliew
Reviews.Content: The Le Walt is a must for lovers in Paris or just Paris lovers! The Le Walt staff delivers 5-star service, and the location and decor of the Hotel could not be better. Salla and her staff were so friendly that we were sad to say goodbye to them as well as Paris. They went the extra mile to find restaurants and make reservations, and make us feel at home. We chose the Le Walt for our honeymoon last September by reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. Upon arriving, we were given a room on the sixth floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower for our stay. The rooms are exactly as pictured - modern decor and clean. The bathrooms are immaculate and larger than many in Europe. The room size is as you expect in Europe, but adequate for two people and 10 days' worth of luggage. We enjoyed breakfast each morning at the hotel, and couldn't possibly start our day without the perfect, freshly ground coffee they serve. You can not find a better location in regard to seeing all of Paris via the metro; but, certainly, do not miss strolling down Rue Cler across the street from the Le Walt or walking to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel. You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Petite Hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cmiller_80
Reviews.Content: As this was my first trip to paris, i did all of my planning and selecting of hotels/restaurants online. In the past, i have had very bad luck sometimes with selecting a hotel online, so i was fearful that Le Walt might not be as nice as it seemed. However, upon arrival, all fears were dispersed. We arrived at the hotel at 9:30 am (having taken an overnight flight the night prior) to drop our bags off. Much to my suprise, they had our room ready! It was wonderful to be able to go immediatly to our room and relax a bit. The room was a nice size, extremely clean, wood floors, great windowlight, full bathtub, nice minibar. Very comfortable. When we had questions, the staff were all very attentive and helpful. Our room was cleaned thoroughly each day. The hotel was in a great location. The metro is literally right out the front door. It is a 10 minute walk from Invalides or the Eiffel tower, and it is not in a very touristy area, which was also a plus. I loved staying at the Le Walt, and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: David_mc
Reviews.Content: I have just returned froma weekend in Paris, staying at the Hotel Le Walt. We stayed in a superior room on the fifth floor - the room itself was compact (as expected) and comfortable, not overfurnished. Focal point was of course the Old Master pastiche painting as a headboard. From our room we were able to view the top third or so of the Eiffel Tower - particularly impressive at dusk during the hourly "sparkling" light show. The bed was firm and comfortable and a free presentation bowl of fruit and chocolates was a welcoming touch. The Bathroom was a fair size and had a range of complimentary toiletry products and soft, good sized towels. Staff were friendly and helpful, responding immediately to my advance booking request and organising taxis. Transport was generally no problem with the hotel being situated next to a Metro station. The hotel itself is very well located - only minutes from the Eiffel Tower, Invalides etc and with a good range of restaurants/bistros/cafes nearby

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Frogberto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, modern, and RIGHT by a metro station, which is very convenient. The staff were all English speaking and very nice. The pros - we had a HUGE room facing the garden, with a crib as requested, and the room is very modern and beautiful, with custom art in each room by local artists. The hotel is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Napoleon's Tomb (Hotel Invalides), and as mentioned, the metro, as well as a charming market area, a laundromat, and some great restaurants. The cons - the night staff pointed out to us that the hotel is understaffed, and uses temporary labor for almost everything. There was usually one person answering phones, handling guest concerns, tending bar, and serving breakfast. The breakfast also isn't worth the 13 Euros charged - better to walk up the street for a larger breakfast that's also cheaper. The night staff pointed out little touches like how the stairwell doors were broken, although that didn't bother me so much. Overall, a very nice place, and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: leighton007
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Le Walt in a classic room on the 6th floor (601). We were instantly struck with the view of the Eiffel tower from both our windows! You could actually lay down and on the bed and see the tower! Our room was a bit on the small side but the classic superior rooms are larger and some have a view of the tower on the 5th floor (and a balcony!). The decor throughout was second to none and all areas were incredibly clean. As for the staff, they couldn't have been more friendly and helpfull. The hotel is central and is just off a metro line for easy access to all of Paris. The only two minor negatives was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the room and the lack of a cooked breakfast option.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault this gorgeous chic boutique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Couldnt fault Le Walt at all. My boyfriend and i stayed here over New Year and the hotel was gorgeous. Was abit disappointed we didnt have a room with a view, but our room just off the courtyard was wonderful and felt like we had our own little private bit of the hotel!! Breakfast was bought to our room every mornng and exactly the time we had asked for and the staff were extremely friendly and welcoming and always insiting upon helping us. The hotel is situated right by a metro station which was great, the metro is fab, dont waste money on cabs when u can take the metro every where its so easy!! Wouldnt highly reccomend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Photo Review”
Reviews.Author: shoelessmike
Reviews.Content: A lot of great reviews so far, so I'll just post some pics. Pic 1 Boutique style hotel--elegant and sophisticated Pic 2 Washroom is modern and chic Pic 3 In case you're wondering... Pic 4 Stayed on second floor. Can't see Eiffel tower. Traffic noise not a problem. Pic 5 Location, location, location The metro is literally steps away! My advice: walk and take the metro back to the hotel when you're tired. Pic 6 Location again! Head out of hotel and hang a right. Keep going for ten minutes and you're at Napoleon's tomb. Or cross the street and you're in the Rue Cler neighbourhood, where you'll find bakeries, fruit markets, cheese shops, chocolatiers, and so on...!!! Pic 7 Rue cler patisserie where we had breakfast every morning. Sit back and enjoy your cafe creme. Friendly service. Speaks English. Remember, you don't need to tip. Pic 8 Rue Cler again -- great place to relax and shop. Has that local flavour. Pic 9 Hang a right and you have a wonderful bakery. A lot of sweets. My wife is still dreaming about the chocolate tart. Pic 10 oops...forgot this pic of our room. Lovely, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, subway noise”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights over US Thanksgiving holidays. Great hotel for individual service, for location, for decor, huge bathrooms. However, DO NOT accept rooms 701 or 702 if you are a light sleeper (like me.) The rooms are on the ground floor, off the courtyard. You'll hear every train which pulls through the station below, from 5:00am until 1:00am. The management wouldn't move us, saying the hotel was full (for 5 nights??). We had prepaid, best deal I found was on hotels. Hotel location is great, just across the street from Rue Cler (a foodie's dream). Eat breakfast at a cafe there, rather than at the hotel. Rue Dominique, an easy walk, has several of restaurants by Constant, which are superb. Use the Supermarche across the street for snacks and sodas. The hotel management was very helpful in getting us a last-minute taxi to CDG, after the Bluevan called to cancel our ride (an hour before pickup). Do not book Bluevan without a backup! The hotel recommended Yellowvan, and said they could have booked that for us with notice. E-mail the hotel with any requests in advance--they DO respond.

Reviews.Title: “Twinkle Tower Delight!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the time of my life in Paris! This hotel was so nice to come home to and rest! The bed was wonderful! The staff delightful! And The view amazing! The staff appologized for not having a good room with a view - like I had requested... and gave us a deal! When in reality the room the was fantastic!!! The view gorgeous! THE EIFFLE TOWER - blinking on every hour!!! If this room was not a room with a view - I cant imagine how the ones with the view look!!!! I would stay here again - as long as I had the money for it! THE LOCATION is the best part! It is right by a metro and all the little cafes and restaurants make it perfect!!!! PLUS there is a market right across the street and a whole foods store... perfect for lunches or dinners when you dont feel like eating out. The pub below serves great home wine! Nice for relaxing close to the hotel after a long day of shopping! JUST LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights for our honeymoon, and loved it! We had a room at the front and loved to be able to open the windows on to the street - there was no noise with the windows closed. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the bathroom clean and well equipped. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the blissfully quiet courtyard a wonderful oasis of calm after a day of walking and sightseeing. As we didn't have time to see all the sights we hoped to, we will be returning to Paris and Le Walt as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and personal Le Walt.”
Reviews.Author: Richieh
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to read an earlier review regarding the 'Lengthy' registration form completion. All they ask for is your name, address, credit card number and a signature. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and I personally find this the norm. Anyway my wife and I found the hotel exceptionally clean and welcoming. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and polite. We stayed in room 402 which had a tremendous view of the (top third!) of the Eiffel Tower. With the room windows open there was a lot of noise from the street below but we knew this before we booked the hotel after reading reviews on this site. The noise is almost completely gone with the double glazed windows closed. (I had originally requested a room overlooking the (quiet) courtyard, but my wife and I were glad to have been given room 402 purely for the views outside of the tower and parisienne life going by). One thing you must try is the room service continental breakfast. For 12 Euros each (approx £8) it is immense. We took the bread and pain chocolat out later in the day and lunched on it saving us from buying another lunch. As other earlier reviews state there is an abundance of restaurants and other eateries within a short walking distance but we found that by using some of the smaller ones down the side streets you will save money without compromising quality, this is true for both food and drink. On our last afternoon we had coffee in the hotels' courtyard and it is extremely quiet. (If you require a quiet room then make sure you ring the hotel and confirm you have been allocated one overlooking the courtyard. It REALLY is quiet) The metro Ecole Militaire is only 30 metres from the hotel and offers you a link to the whole of central Paris. We didn't really notice the underground noise from our room. On arrival you can purchase a 'Paris Visite' travel ticket from any station counter. These can be for 1,2,3, or 5 days and cover travel on Metro, bus, RER and coach. Make sure you buy the one covering the zones you want to use. E,g zones 1-3 cover central Paris whereas zones 1-8 will get you back to the CDG airport via RER. (See this link for more info) -------------------- The 'Paris Visite' ticket also has discount vouchers for a number of attractions. Another must for tourists are the river cruises. Bateaux Parisienne or Batobus can be taken from the base of the Eiffel Tower and for approx 10 Euros the trip will give you good views of a number of well known sights. When out and about on the Champs Elysees area watch out for the Japanese tourists who ask you to buy designer goods for them. They will give you hundreds of Euros and follow you to (Luis Vuitton for example) to buy special edition items. These items are usually sold as a maximum of one per customer. The designer outlets are on to this and, after questioning you about if you've been approached in the street by someome, will often refuse to sell you items unless you pay with your own credit card. It is very rare that I ever stay in the same hotel twice as I like to try different ones but if I did stay in the same area of Paris again I would use the Le Walt.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review of Le Walt - Mostly positive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never left a review like this, but since I relied so much on them when planning our trip, I thought it was only fair to leave my own. I agree with many of the previous reviews regarding this hotel. The rooms are on the small side (think the width of a small queen bed plus a few feet), they are pretty clean but certainly not perfect, and are quite comfortable in terms of the bed and bathroom. If your goal is to have a big spacious room then this is not the place for you. The location is the big draw to this hotel in my opinion . . . being able to see the Eiffel Tower out your window and walk to it in 10 minutes is amazing. Plus having the Metro stop right outside your door is very convenient (we did not plan on using the Metro a lot, but it was so easy and cheap that we used it quite a bit). The street that it's on is moderately busy but not too busy in my opinion. It has everything that you could want right outside your door . . . many cafe options, a small grocery store for supplies across the street, and several nice shops right around the hotel. My mixed reviews concern the staff. They were extremely nice and friendly both in helping with the planning of our trip and during our time there. Almost all of the staff spoke perfect english, and were always available to answer questions. My biggest complaint would be that they didn't always seem to have the "insider knowledge" that you would hope to get when paying for a hotel in this range. Often times they relied on a Google search for our questions that I would think they would have more knowledge of. If you have a good handle on knowing what you want to do and are not looking for a lot of guidance from the hotel then I don't think this is an issue, but if you are looking for a good support system while in Paris I would be a little careful. Overall we had an amazing time in Paris, and I was quite pleased with the hotel. I certainly would consider staying at the hotel again, but left with a feeling of wanting just a little bit more from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BLUEEYES65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 8 nights at the Le Walt. The staff at the hotel was great. All requests were quickly and graciously granted. Our room was small, but clean and very comfortable. Bathroom was great for both showers and baths. The beds and pillows may be the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. They made arrangements for us for tours. They arranged for a taxi back to CDG during AM rush hour, which is truly a feat! I ate breakfast every morning at the hotel. I found the convenience and the quality of the coffee and food to be worth the 12 Euros. Our room had a view of the Tour Eiffel and the Avenue de la Motte Picquet. It could be a little noisy, but being able to see the Tour Eiffel and watching Parisian life on this busy street made up for the noise. We had plenty of room in the mini-bar for our own supplies. We had free internet in the room. The location was perfect. The Metro right outside the door. A taxi stand around the corner. A short walk to the Tour Eiffel and the Hotel des Invalides. We used the Batobus for transportation on many days. It was cheap and a better view than the Metro. You can find it at the bottom of the Quai at the Tour Eiffel. The 7th district (where the Le Walt is located) is one of the most affluential neighborhoods in Paris. We really enjoyed just walking around the neighborhood. Lots of restaurants and stores. Most of the buildings are the original Haussman style buildings and quite beautiful. It is also very safe. I walked around by myself on several occasions and felt safe. Usually, I am a big chicken!! My advice for going to Paris: Don't expect the French to be mean to you. This trip just reinforced what I already knew: People will treat you the way that you treat them. I found the Parisians to be very friendly. WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES! I cannot stress this enough. You will do a great deal of walking in Paris. Anyhow, I found that the Parisians dress much more casually than I was lead to believe. Overall, our trip was great!!! Much of this was due to the wonderful Le Walt and the wonderful neighborhood it is in. I am planning to return to Paris in a few years with my sister and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walt(z) to another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Walt has managed to capture the American audience but with it's policy driven approach to service, I'd like to suggest that it's not all that French. We've spent years traveling in France and have stayed in all types of accommodations but this is the first one ever to ask us to complete a lengthy registration form - despite the fact that the first night was already paid for due to an advance booking. Most hotels simply ask for your last name, it's a refreshing change from the American system and one that operates on respect and honor. The rooms and breakfast area were eye catching, but our bed spread and the pillows were so dirty that we didn't want to touch them! Our deluxe room rumbled until the wee hours with the noise of either the metro or the elevator ( perhaps both). The staff really thought they were something special but failed to add one tread of ambiance or warmth to the hotel (except the sweet young woman from Le Puy). Paris has so many wonderful hotels, and we look forward to staying in one of those in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevinruskie
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are typically on the small side. That said in keeping with the rest of the hotel they have resently been completely refurbished to high standard. The staff and service was superb and friendly. Very good location. We were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel; Brilliant Staff”
Reviews.Author: recentlyretired
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at Le Walt and we were really pleased with our choice. The decor is elegant and light, and our bedroom, although not on the front as we had asked, was spacious and tastefully furnished. The breakfast was substantial and served by a very cheerful young lady. They even had Earl Grey tea for my friend! The staff were very helpful with a serious problem. My friend left her bag in the Shuttle with credit cards, money, phone and (worst of all) her passport! Marie on the desk rang around the police, embassy etc to find out where we had to go and then gave us a map with everything marked on it. We then spent a lot of time reporting the loss and getting a replacement passport. Tres complique. Not to be recommended when you are only there for 3 days! Fortunately, I speak French so was able to explain to the police etc but it was still very stressful and expensive (several metro journeys and £70 for a new passport at the British Embassy!) Quel rip- off! The position of the hotel is ideal. The Tower is quite close and we went to the Champ de Mars each night to watch the sparkly lights on the hour. Quite beautiful! So I would recommend Le Walt to anyone You might get a better deal booking directly with the hotel. I noticed that their rack rate was better than what we paid via Paris Direct. That surprised me. I would certainly go back!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Le Walt
HotelInfo.Address: 37, Avenue de la Motte Picquet | 7 Arr., 75007 Paris, France
